name: Actidil Elixir
description: Actidil Elixir is commonly used for the treatment of cough and upper respiratory tract infections. It contains Triprolidine hydrochloride, an antihistamine that works by blocking histamine, a substance in the body that causes allergy symptoms. This syrup formulation is especially effective in reducing symptoms such as a runny nose, sneezing, and watery eyes, making it ideal for seasonal allergies and colds. It is gentle enough for pediatric use when prescribed by a doctor, providing relief for both dry and productive coughs.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 teaspoons every 6-8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Aldactone Tablets
description: Aldactone, also known by its generic name spironolactone, is a potassium-sparing diuretic. It works by preventing your body from absorbing too much salt while retaining potassium levels. This medication is used to treat conditions such as heart failure, hypertension, and edema caused by liver cirrhosis or kidney disease. In some cases, it is prescribed for hormonal disorders like polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Aldactone also has anti-androgen properties, which make it useful for treating conditions like acne and hirsutism in women.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-200 mg per day in divided doses
recommendedDosage.children: Not commonly recommended; consult a doctor

name: Alprazolam Tablets
description: Alprazolam, commonly known by the brand name Xanax, is a benzodiazepine medication used to manage anxiety disorders, panic attacks, and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). It works by enhancing the activity of certain neurotransmitters in the brain, producing a calming effect. This medication is also effective in managing short-term insomnia related to anxiety. Due to its fast action, it is often prescribed for acute episodes of severe anxiety or panic attacks.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.25-0.5 mg three times daily as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for individuals under 18 years

name: Amoxil 250 mg Capsules
description: Amoxil is a broad-spectrum antibiotic that belongs to the penicillin class of medications. It is commonly prescribed to treat a variety of bacterial infections, including ear infections, throat infections, respiratory tract infections, and urinary tract infections. Amoxil works by interfering with the bacterial cell wall formation, ultimately killing the bacteria and stopping the infection. It is effective against a wide range of bacteria and is considered a first-line treatment for many infections.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg every 8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Dose depends on weight; consult a doctor

name: Amoxil 500 mg Capsules
description: Amoxil 500 mg is a higher-strength antibiotic used to treat more severe bacterial infections, such as pneumonia, bronchitis, and skin infections. Like the 250 mg version, it belongs to the penicillin class of antibiotics and works by inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis. This higher dosage is often prescribed for adults or in cases where the infection requires more aggressive treatment.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Dose depends on weight; consult a doctor

name: Amoxil Drops
description: Amoxil Drops are a liquid formulation of amoxicillin, designed specifically for pediatric use. They are prescribed to treat a wide range of bacterial infections, including ear infections, throat infections, and respiratory or urinary tract infections in children. The liquid form allows for easier administration to young children who may not be able to swallow pills or capsules. Amoxil works by inhibiting the growth of bacteria, preventing them from forming cell walls and ultimately killing the bacteria.

recommendedDosage.children: 50 mg/kg daily in divided doses; consult a doctor

name: Amoxil Syrup 125mg
description: Amoxil Syrup 125mg is a syrup formulation of amoxicillin, designed for children to treat a variety of bacterial infections, including those affecting the respiratory tract, ear, nose, throat, and urinary system. This formulation provides an easy-to-administer liquid option for pediatric patients who have difficulty swallowing pills or capsules. It works by preventing bacterial cells from forming their protective cell walls, causing the bacteria to die and stop multiplying. Amoxil is a widely used and effective antibiotic.

recommendedDosage.children: 5 ml (125 mg) every 8 hours for children under 10 years

name: Amoxil Syrup 250mg
description: Amoxil Syrup 250mg is a higher strength syrup formulation of amoxicillin, used to treat more serious or extensive bacterial infections in children. This antibiotic is effective for treating respiratory infections like pneumonia, ear infections, and skin infections, among others. It works by targeting the bacterial cell wall, weakening it, and ultimately killing the bacteria. The liquid form is especially useful for children who are unable to take tablets or capsules, making it an ideal option for young patients with bacterial infections.

recommendedDosage.children: 5 ml (250 mg) every 8 hours for children over 10 years

name: Ampiclox 250mg Capsules
description: Ampiclox 250mg Capsules are a combination antibiotic that contains ampicillin and cloxacillin. This medication is used to treat a variety of bacterial infections, such as ear, throat, and lung infections. Ampiclox works by inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis, effectively killing the bacteria causing the infection. It is commonly prescribed for mild to moderate bacterial infections. The combination of ampicillin (a penicillin-type antibiotic) and cloxacillin (a penicillinase-resistant antibiotic) makes it more effective against a wider range of bacteria.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg every 6 hours

name: Ampiclox 500mg Capsules
description: Ampiclox 500mg Capsules are a higher strength combination antibiotic used to treat more severe bacterial infections. It contains ampicillin and cloxacillin, which work synergistically to combat a broader spectrum of bacterial pathogens. This medication is commonly prescribed for serious bacterial infections such as pneumonia, urinary tract infections, and skin infections. The higher dosage is typically used in adults or in more severe cases. By inhibiting the bacterial cell wall synthesis, Ampiclox causes bacterial cell death and helps stop the infection.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 6 hours for severe infections

name: Ampiclox Drops
description: Ampiclox Drops is an oral antibiotic specifically designed for children. It contains a combination of ampicillin and cloxacillin, which work together to treat various bacterial infections, including ear infections, respiratory tract infections, and skin infections. The liquid form makes it easier to administer the medication to young children who may have difficulty swallowing pills. It is effective in inhibiting bacterial growth by disrupting the bacterial cell wall, ultimately killing the bacteria causing the infection.

recommendedDosage.children: 25 mg/kg every 8 hours for children under 10 years

name: Ampiclox Syrup 250mg
description: Ampiclox Syrup 250mg is a liquid antibiotic formulation that combines ampicillin and cloxacillin, designed to treat bacterial infections in children. This syrup form is ideal for young patients who cannot swallow pills or capsules. It is commonly used to treat infections like otitis media, respiratory infections, and urinary tract infections. The combination of ampicillin and cloxacillin allows the medication to be effective against a broad spectrum of bacteria, ensuring that both penicillin-sensitive and penicillin-resistant bacteria are targeted.

recommendedDosage.children: 5 ml (250 mg) every 8 hours for children over 5 years

name: Angised Tablets
description: Angised Tablets are used to manage and relieve chest pain caused by angina, a condition where the heart's blood supply is temporarily reduced. These tablets contain a nitrate that helps relax and widen the blood vessels, improving blood flow to the heart and easing the pain associated with angina. It is commonly used to treat acute angina attacks and can help manage symptoms when taken sublingually (under the tongue) for rapid absorption. Angised can also help in preventing further angina episodes when used regularly.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet sublingually during an angina attack

name: Atarax Tablet 25mg
description: Atarax (Hydroxyzine) 25mg Tablets are an antihistamine commonly used to treat symptoms of anxiety, allergies, nausea, and as a sedative for short-term use. It works by blocking the effects of histamine in the body, reducing symptoms like itching, sneezing, and runny nose caused by allergies. Atarax is also used for its calming effects to help reduce anxiety and tension in patients before surgeries or medical procedures. The medication is sedative in nature, helping patients relax and sleep.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg three to four times daily

name: Augmentin 1g Tablets
description: Augmentin 1g Tablets are a combination antibiotic medication used to treat various bacterial infections, including sinusitis, pneumonia, and infections of the skin, urinary tract, and respiratory system. This formulation contains amoxicillin, a penicillin-type antibiotic, and clavulanic acid, which helps overcome bacterial resistance to amoxicillin. Augmentin works by interfering with the bacterial cell wall, killing the bacteria. It is highly effective against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 g (1 tablet) twice daily

name: Augmentin 375mg Tablets
description: Augmentin 375mg Tablets are a lower-dose antibiotic combination containing amoxicillin and clavulanic acid. These tablets are used to treat mild bacterial infections such as respiratory tract infections, ear infections, and urinary tract infections. The amoxicillin component works by disrupting bacterial cell wall synthesis, while clavulanic acid inhibits beta-lactamase, an enzyme produced by certain bacteria that would otherwise render amoxicillin ineffective. This combination extends the effectiveness of the antibiotic to treat a wider range of bacterial infections.

recommendedDosage.adults: 375 mg (1 tablet) three times daily for mild infections

name: Augmentin 625mg Tablets
description: Augmentin 625mg Tablets are a combination antibiotic used to treat a variety of moderate bacterial infections, including respiratory infections like pneumonia, sinusitis, and bronchitis, as well as skin and soft tissue infections. The combination of amoxicillin and clavulanic acid allows it to be effective against a broad range of bacteria, including those that produce beta-lactamase, an enzyme that can resist some antibiotics. This formulation is used when a stronger antibiotic is necessary for moderate infections that do not respond to first-line treatments.

recommendedDosage.adults: 625 mg (1 tablet) three times daily for moderate infections

name: Augmentin Drops
description: Augmentin Drops is a pediatric formulation of the combination antibiotic amoxicillin and clavulanic acid. This liquid form is specifically designed for young children to treat bacterial infections like ear infections, respiratory infections, and urinary tract infections. The inclusion of clavulanic acid helps to overcome bacterial resistance and enhances the effectiveness of amoxicillin. The drops are easy to administer and offer a suitable option for children under 10 years who are unable to take tablets.

recommendedDosage.children: 30 mg/kg/day divided into two doses for children under 10 years

name: Augmentin Suspension 156.25mg
description: Augmentin Suspension 156.25mg is a liquid antibiotic designed for children to treat a variety of bacterial infections. The lower dose of amoxicillin and clavulanic acid in this formulation makes it appropriate for younger children, particularly for treating ear infections, throat infections, and mild respiratory infections. The convenient suspension form ensures easier administration and better compliance for pediatric patients.

recommendedDosage.children: 5 ml (156.25 mg) every 12 hours for children under 5 years

name: Augmentin Suspension 312.5mg
description: Augmentin Suspension 312.5mg is a stronger pediatric suspension used to treat moderate bacterial infections in children. This formulation is appropriate for older children who require a higher dose of the antibiotic to combat infections like pneumonia, bronchitis, and other upper respiratory infections. Like other Augmentin formulations, it contains amoxicillin and clavulanic acid, which enhances the antibiotic's ability to treat resistant bacteria.

recommendedDosage.children: 5 ml (312.5 mg) every 12 hours for children over 5 years

name: Augmentin Suspension 457mg/5ml
description: Augmentin Suspension 457mg/5ml is a high-dose liquid formulation designed for the treatment of severe bacterial infections in children. This suspension is typically used for infections that are resistant to standard antibiotics and requires the higher dose for more intensive treatment. It is highly effective against a wide range of bacterial infections, including severe respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, and skin infections. The presence of clavulanic acid helps to overcome bacterial resistance mechanisms.

recommendedDosage.children: 5 ml (457 mg) every 12 hours for severe infections in children

name: Avamys Nasal Spray
description: Avamys Nasal Spray is a corticosteroid nasal spray commonly used to treat allergic rhinitis, which includes symptoms like nasal congestion, sneezing, and runny nose. It works by reducing inflammation in the nasal passages, thereby relieving symptoms of allergic reactions. It is often prescribed for seasonal and perennial allergies and can also help reduce symptoms associated with hay fever and dust mite allergies. Avamys is effective in providing relief and is typically used once daily for long-term management.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2 sprays in each nostril once daily

name: Avodart Capsules
description: Avodart, containing the active ingredient dutasteride, is primarily used to treat benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), a condition in which the prostate gland becomes enlarged. It works by inhibiting the enzyme responsible for converting testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT), which can cause prostate growth. By reducing DHT levels, Avodart helps shrink the prostate, reduce urinary symptoms, and lower the risk of urinary retention and the need for surgery. It is also used off-label to treat male pattern baldness.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 capsule (0.5 mg) once daily

name: Azithromycin 250mg Tablets
description: Azithromycin 250mg Tablets are a broad-spectrum antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections, including respiratory tract infections, ear infections, and certain sexually transmitted diseases. It belongs to the class of antibiotics known as macrolides, which work by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. Azithromycin is commonly prescribed for conditions like bronchitis, pneumonia, and strep throat. Its long half-life allows it to be taken once daily, making it a convenient choice for short courses of therapy.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg once daily for 3-5 days, depending on the infection

name: Azithromycin 500mg Tablets
description: Azithromycin 500mg Tablets are a higher-dose formulation of the antibiotic azithromycin used to treat more severe bacterial infections such as pneumonia, severe bronchitis, and skin infections. As a macrolide antibiotic, azithromycin works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis, effectively killing bacteria or preventing their growth. This higher dose is typically prescribed for acute or resistant infections that require more potent treatment, with a course of therapy often lasting between 3 to 5 days.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg once daily for 3-5 days, depending on the infection

name: Azithromycin Oral Suspension
description: Azithromycin Oral Suspension is a liquid form of azithromycin, designed for use in children and patients who have difficulty swallowing tablets. It is used to treat various bacterial infections such as ear infections, pneumonia, and certain skin infections. The oral suspension provides an alternative to tablets and is especially useful for pediatric patients. Azithromycin works by inhibiting the synthesis of essential proteins in bacteria, which stops their growth and ultimately eliminates the infection.

recommendedDosage.children: 10 mg/kg daily for 3 days

name: Azelastine 137mcg Nasal Spray
description: Azelastine 137mcg Nasal Spray is an antihistamine nasal spray used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis, including sneezing, runny nose, and nasal congestion. It works by blocking histamine, a substance in the body that causes allergic symptoms. Azelastine is particularly effective for treating seasonal allergies and can also help reduce symptoms associated with hay fever. This nasal spray formulation allows the drug to directly act on the nasal passages for quick relief.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 spray in each nostril twice daily

name: Aspirin Tablets
description: Aspirin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever. It is commonly used for headaches, muscle pain, arthritis, and as a blood thinner to prevent heart attacks and strokes. Aspirin works by inhibiting enzymes that produce prostaglandins, which are responsible for inflammation, pain, and fever. This makes it useful for both acute and chronic pain relief, as well as for cardiovascular protection when used in low doses.
formula: Aspirin 300 mg or 500 mg (varies by tablet strength)

recommendedDosage.adults: 300-500 mg every 4-6 hours as needed

name: Atorvastatin 10mg Tablets
description: Atorvastatin 10mg Tablets are used to lower cholesterol levels and reduce the risk of heart disease, including stroke and heart attacks. It belongs to the statin class of medications, which work by inhibiting an enzyme involved in cholesterol production in the liver. By lowering LDL (bad cholesterol) and triglycerides and increasing HDL (good cholesterol), atorvastatin helps prevent the buildup of plaque in the arteries, improving cardiovascular health. This medication is usually prescribed for individuals with high cholesterol or those at risk of heart disease.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily, preferably in the evening

name: Atorvastatin 20mg Tablets
description: Atorvastatin 20mg Tablets are a higher dose of atorvastatin, prescribed for individuals who require more intensive treatment to control their cholesterol levels. Like the 10mg dose, atorvastatin works by blocking the enzyme responsible for cholesterol production in the liver. It effectively lowers LDL (bad cholesterol) and triglycerides, helping to prevent cardiovascular disease and related complications. This dosage is typically prescribed to individuals with significantly high cholesterol levels or those at higher risk for heart disease.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily

name: Atenolol 25mg Tablets
description: Atenolol 25mg Tablets are a beta-blocker medication used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and heart conditions like angina and arrhythmias. It works by blocking the effects of adrenaline on the heart, resulting in a slower heart rate and reduced blood pressure. Atenolol can also be used to prevent heart attacks and manage symptoms of anxiety. It is often prescribed for long-term management of cardiovascular diseases and helps improve heart function by reducing strain on the heart.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg once daily

name: Atenolol 50mg Tablets
description: Atenolol 50mg Tablets are a higher dose of the beta-blocker medication atenolol, used to manage high blood pressure (hypertension), chest pain (angina), and heart conditions such as arrhythmias. By blocking the effects of adrenaline, atenolol reduces heart rate and blood pressure, making it easier for the heart to pump blood. Atenolol is typically prescribed for long-term management of heart disease and to reduce the risk of heart attacks and strokes. It is also beneficial for managing symptoms of anxiety by controlling physical symptoms like rapid heartbeat.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg once daily

name: Amlodipine 5mg Tablets
description: Amlodipine 5mg Tablets are a calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and chest pain (angina). Amlodipine works by relaxing the blood vessels, allowing the heart to pump more efficiently and lowering blood pressure. It is also used to prevent angina by improving blood flow to the heart muscle. This medication helps to reduce the risk of heart-related issues, such as heart attacks and strokes, by controlling blood pressure and preventing angina symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg once daily

name: Amlodipine 10mg Tablets
description: Amlodipine 10mg Tablets are a higher dose of the calcium channel blocker amlodipine, used for managing high blood pressure (hypertension) and angina. By relaxing and widening blood vessels, amlodipine helps reduce the heart's workload and lowers blood pressure. The higher dosage is often prescribed for patients who need more significant control over blood pressure or have more severe angina symptoms. It helps prevent heart attacks and strokes by improving cardiovascular health.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily

name: Acyclovir Tablets
description: Acyclovir Tablets are an antiviral medication used to treat herpes simplex virus infections, including cold sores, genital herpes, and shingles (herpes zoster). It works by inhibiting the replication of the virus, thereby reducing the severity and duration of symptoms. Acyclovir is typically prescribed for both the initial and recurrent outbreaks of herpes infections. It is particularly effective for managing symptoms of cold sores and genital herpes, as well as reducing the risk of transmission in patients with active infections.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg five times daily for 5-10 days

name: Acyclovir 5% Cream
description: Acyclovir 5% Cream is a topical antiviral treatment used for managing symptoms of herpes simplex infections, such as cold sores and genital herpes lesions. The cream works by preventing the herpes virus from replicating, thereby reducing the severity and duration of symptoms. It is most effective when applied early in the course of an outbreak and can be used for both initial and recurrent episodes of the infection. The cream helps to alleviate pain, itching, and discomfort associated with cold sores and genital herpes.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply every 3 hours while awake for 7 days

name: Amiodarone Tablets
description: Amiodarone Tablets are a medication used to treat and prevent irregular heartbeats, particularly in patients with arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation or ventricular tachycardia. It works by stabilizing the electrical activity in the heart, helping to restore a normal rhythm. Due to its potent effects, amiodarone is often prescribed for severe heart conditions that cannot be controlled by other medications. However, it can cause significant side effects, including liver toxicity, thyroid dysfunction, and lung issues, so it is closely monitored by healthcare providers.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg once daily for heart rhythm control

name: Aspirin 75mg Tablets
description: Aspirin 75mg Tablets are a low-dose formulation of aspirin commonly used to reduce the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events. Aspirin works by inhibiting platelets in the blood from clumping together, thereby reducing the formation of blood clots. It is typically used in individuals who have a history of cardiovascular disease or are at high risk. While effective, aspirin can increase the risk of bleeding and cause stomach irritation, making it essential for patients to follow their doctor's instructions carefully.

recommendedDosage.adults: 75 mg once daily

name: Amlodipine 2.5mg Tablets
description: Amlodipine 2.5mg Tablets are a lower dose of amlodipine, a calcium channel blocker, used to treat high blood pressure and chest pain (angina). It works by relaxing the blood vessels, which lowers blood pressure and allows for better blood flow to the heart. This medication is especially useful for patients who need a milder dose to manage their hypertension or angina symptoms. As a lower dose, it may be prescribed to individuals who are sensitive to higher doses or have kidney problems.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2.5 mg once daily

name: Azathioprine Tablets
description: Azathioprine Tablets are an immunosuppressive drug used primarily to prevent organ transplant rejection and treat autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, and inflammatory bowel disease. Azathioprine works by inhibiting the production of certain immune cells, which reduces the body's immune response. It helps prevent the immune system from attacking the transplanted organ or the body's own tissues. However, due to its effect on the immune system, it can increase the risk of infections and cause liver toxicity or low white blood cell counts.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-3 mg/kg/day, adjusted according to response

name: Alendronate Sodium 70mg Tablets
description: Alendronate Sodium 70mg Tablets are used to treat and prevent osteoporosis, particularly in postmenopausal women and men. This medication is a bisphosphonate that works by inhibiting bone resorption, which helps to maintain bone density and prevent fractures. Alendronate is commonly prescribed to individuals at risk of osteoporosis or those who have already experienced bone fractures due to weakened bones. It is also used in the treatment of Paget's disease of bone. Patients should take this medication with a full glass of water and avoid lying down for at least 30 minutes after taking it to prevent irritation of the esophagus.

recommendedDosage.adults: 70 mg once weekly

name: Amitriptyline 10mg Tablets
description: Amitriptyline 10mg Tablets are a tricyclic antidepressant commonly used to treat depression, anxiety, and chronic pain conditions such as neuropathic pain and fibromyalgia. It works by increasing the levels of certain neurotransmitters in the brain, which helps to improve mood and relieve pain. Amitriptyline is often prescribed for its sedative properties, helping patients who suffer from insomnia as a result of depression or anxiety. However, it can cause side effects such as drowsiness, dry mouth, and weight gain, especially when used long-term.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-25 mg at bedtime

name: Amitriptyline 25mg Tablets
description: Amitriptyline 25mg Tablets are a higher dose formulation of Amitriptyline, used to treat depression, anxiety, and neuropathic pain, such as that caused by diabetic neuropathy or fibromyalgia. As a tricyclic antidepressant, Amitriptyline works by increasing the levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, which helps to improve mood and reduce pain. It also has sedative effects, making it useful in treating insomnia related to depression or chronic pain conditions. Long-term use can lead to side effects such as drowsiness, dry mouth, and weight gain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg at bedtime

name: Acetaminophen 500mg Tablets
description: Acetaminophen 500mg Tablets are a common over-the-counter pain reliever and fever reducer used to treat headaches, mild pain, and fever. Acetaminophen works by inhibiting the production of chemicals in the brain that cause pain and fever. It is generally considered safe when taken as directed, but overuse or exceeding the recommended daily dose can lead to serious liver damage. This medication is widely used for pain management and is available in many forms, including tablets, syrups, and suppositories.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 4-6 hours as needed, up to 4 grams per day

name: Acetaminophen 100mg/5ml Syrup
description: Acetaminophen 100mg/5ml Syrup is a liquid form of acetaminophen that is commonly used to relieve pain and reduce fever in children. It is an ideal choice for children who have difficulty swallowing tablets or capsules. Just like its tablet form, it works by inhibiting chemicals in the brain that cause pain and fever. The syrup should be carefully dosed based on the child’s weight to avoid overdose, which can lead to liver damage. Parents should follow the prescribed dosage guidelines to ensure safety.

recommendedDosage.children: 10-15 mg/kg every 4-6 hours

name: Azopt Eye Drops
description: Azopt Eye Drops are used to treat elevated intraocular pressure in individuals with glaucoma or ocular hypertension. The active ingredient, brinzolamide, is a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor that reduces the production of fluid inside the eye, which in turn lowers intraocular pressure. Proper use of these eye drops helps prevent damage to the optic nerve and protects against vision loss in glaucoma patients. Common side effects include mild burning or irritation in the eyes.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 drop in affected eye(s) twice daily

name: Aripiprazole Tablets
description: Aripiprazole Tablets are an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and as an adjunct treatment for depression. Aripiprazole works by balancing the levels of dopamine and serotonin in the brain, which helps to improve symptoms such as hallucinations, mood swings, and depressive episodes. It is considered one of the newer, more well-tolerated antipsychotics, though it can still cause side effects like dizziness, drowsiness, and weight gain. It may also be used for managing irritability in autism spectrum disorder.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-15 mg once daily

name: Benadryl Syrup
description: Benadryl Syrup is an over-the-counter antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergy, hay fever, and the common cold. These symptoms include rash, itching, watery eyes, itchy eyes/nose/throat, cough, runny nose, and sneezing. It is also used to relieve motion sickness and to induce sleep. Benadryl works by blocking histamine, a substance in the body that causes allergic symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-50 mg every 4-6 hours (max 300 mg per day)
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age

name: Baclofen Tablets
description: Baclofen is a muscle relaxant used to treat spasticity (muscle stiffness and spasms) caused by conditions like multiple sclerosis or spinal cord injuries. It works by acting on the central nervous system to relax muscles, thereby relieving muscle spasms and pain. Baclofen may also be prescribed for the treatment of other conditions involving muscle stiffness.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg 3 times a day, gradually increasing to 20-30 mg daily as prescribed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age

name: Benzathine Penicillin
description: Benzathine Penicillin is an antibiotic used for the treatment of various bacterial infections, including syphilis, rheumatic fever, and streptococcal throat infections. It is a long-acting form of penicillin, typically administered via injection. It works by preventing bacteria from forming cell walls, leading to their death. Benzathine Penicillin is especially effective for treating infections that require prolonged antibiotic action.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1.2 million units injected once for syphilis or as directed for other conditions
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age and weight

name: Bromhexine Syrup
description: Bromhexine is an expectorant used to help clear mucus from the respiratory tract. It is commonly used for treating chronic respiratory diseases, such as chronic bronchitis, asthma, or COPD. Bromhexine works by thinning and loosening the mucus in the lungs, making it easier to cough up and expel.

recommendedDosage.adults: 8-16 mg 3 times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age

name: Betamethasone Tablets
description: Betamethasone is a corticosteroid used to treat a variety of inflammatory and autoimmune conditions, such as allergies, skin conditions, and arthritis. It is also used to manage severe inflammation in the body and can be prescribed for conditions like asthma, psoriasis, and ulcerative colitis. Betamethasone works by reducing inflammation and suppressing the immune system.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.5-2 mg daily, depending on condition severity
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age

name: Bicalutamide Tablets
description: Bicalutamide is a non-steroidal anti-androgen used to treat prostate cancer. It works by blocking the action of male hormones (androgens) such as testosterone on prostate cancer cells. By inhibiting androgen receptors, Bicalutamide slows the growth of prostate cancer cells. It is often used in combination with other treatments like luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone (LHRH) agonists.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg once a day
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Bupropion Tablets
description: Bupropion is an antidepressant and smoking cessation aid, primarily used to treat depression, seasonal affective disorder, and to help individuals quit smoking. It works by altering the levels of neurotransmitters like dopamine and norepinephrine in the brain. Bupropion can also be used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

recommendedDosage.adults: 150 mg once daily, increasing to 300 mg if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Bisoprolol Tablets
description: Bisoprolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and angina (chest pain). It works by blocking certain receptors in the heart, which slows down the heart rate and reduces blood pressure. This helps to reduce the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular problems.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg daily, depending on condition severity
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Budesonide Inhaler
description: Budesonide Inhaler is a corticosteroid used to manage asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It works by reducing inflammation in the airways, which helps to prevent asthma attacks and other breathing difficulties. Budesonide is often used as a long-term preventive treatment rather than for immediate relief.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 inhalations twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age

name: Benzocaine Gel
description: Benzocaine Gel is a local anesthetic used to relieve pain and discomfort caused by minor burns, cuts, or abrasions. It is also used to treat sore throats and oral ulcers. Benzocaine works by numbing the affected area to reduce pain and discomfort temporarily.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a small amount to the affected area 3-4 times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage based on age

name: Bupropion SR Tablets
description: Bupropion SR (sustained release) is an antidepressant medication used to treat depression, seasonal affective disorder, and as a smoking cessation aid. It works by increasing the levels of certain neurotransmitters, such as dopamine and norepinephrine, in the brain. Bupropion SR is designed to release the drug gradually, providing a longer-lasting effect.

recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 10 years old

name: Bicalutamide 150 mg

It works by blocking the action of androgens (male hormones such as testosterone), which can fuel the growth of cancer cells. This dosage is typically used in combination with other medications such as luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone (LHRH) agonists.

recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Benzylpenicillin

It works by depressing the central nervous system, leading to sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle-relaxant effects. Bromazepam is commonly prescribed for short-term use to alleviate symptoms of anxiety and related disorders.

recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Benzyl Alcohol

name: Brufen 400mg Tablets
description: Brufen 400mg Tablets contain ibuprofen, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, inflammation, and fever. It works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, chemicals in the body that cause pain and inflammation. Brufen is commonly used to treat conditions such as arthritis, muscle pain, headaches, menstrual cramps, and mild to moderate pain. It also helps reduce fever and inflammation associated with various conditions. This medication should be used with caution in individuals with a history of gastrointestinal issues or kidney problems.

This medication is commonly prescribed for respiratory infections like bronchitis and pneumonia, urinary tract infections, ear infections, and skin infections. It is generally well tolerated, but may cause gastrointestinal disturbances or allergic reactions in some patients.

It works by targeting the bacterial cell wall, causing the bacteria to rupture and die. Cefdinir is commonly used for conditions such as otitis media (middle ear infection), community-acquired pneumonia, and streptococcal pharyngitis. It is important to complete the full course of therapy to avoid the development of antibiotic-resistant bacteria.

This medication is often prescribed for infections of the respiratory tract (e.g., sinusitis, pneumonia), urinary tract infections, and skin infections. Cefprozil works by inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis, ultimately causing bacterial cell death. It may cause mild side effects such as gastrointestinal upset, but severe side effects are rare.

It is used in hospital settings for severe infections and for infections that do not respond to other antibiotics. It works by disrupting the bacterial cell wall, leading to cell death. It may cause side effects such as diarrhea, rash, and nausea, and should be used under medical supervision.

name: Dexamethasone Tablets
description: Dexamethasone is a corticosteroid used to treat various conditions such as inflammation, autoimmune diseases, and certain cancers. It works by reducing inflammation and suppressing the immune system. It's commonly prescribed for conditions like arthritis, asthma, and skin conditions, as well as to reduce swelling in the brain or other organs. Long-term use can lead to side effects such as weight gain, osteoporosis, and high blood pressure.

Diazepam has sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant properties, making it effective for managing anxiety and certain muscle or seizure-related conditions. Long-term use can result in dependency, and it should not be mixed with alcohol or other sedatives.

It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis. It is also used for malaria prevention and to treat acne. It's important to take doxycycline with plenty of water and avoid sun exposure as it can increase sensitivity to sunlight.

It works by inhibiting enzymes involved in the production of prostaglandins, which are chemicals that cause inflammation and pain. Diclofenac can cause gastrointestinal side effects, including stomach ulcers or bleeding, especially with long-term use.

It works by blocking the effects of histamine, a substance in the body that causes allergic symptoms. It is also used to treat insomnia, motion sickness, and as an adjunct in the treatment of Parkinson’s disease. It may cause drowsiness and is often included in over-the-counter sleep aids.

It is commonly used to treat nausea, vomiting, and gastric motility disorders, and it may be used in managing symptoms of indigestion or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Long-term use can lead to serious side effects, including immunosuppression, osteoporosis, and weight gain.

Daclatasvir is often prescribed as part of a multi-drug regimen to increase the effectiveness of treatment, typically in combination with sofosbuvir or ribavirin, depending on the strain and the patient's condition. It has been shown to improve sustained virologic response rates in patients with different genotypes of HCV.

Lactulose works by drawing water into the bowel, softening stools, and facilitating bowel movements. It is commonly used for chronic constipation and in cases where other laxatives are ineffective. Mefenamic acid works by inhibiting cyclooxygenase enzymes (COX-1 and COX-2), which are involved in the production of prostaglandins that cause pain and inflammation. It is also used for other conditions like muscle pain, joint pain, and mild to moderate pain relief. Dysmen can be effective in reducing the intensity of menstrual cramps and related discomfort.

Diuretics work by removing excess sodium and water from the body, thus reducing fluid buildup and lowering blood pressure. There are different types of diuretics, including thiazides, loop diuretics, and potassium-sparing diuretics, each with its specific uses and side effects.
