recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage, especially for long-term use

name: Dicloran Tablets
description: Dicloran Tablets contain diclofenac, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain and inflammation in conditions such as osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and ankylosing spondylitis. Diclofenac works by inhibiting cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes, which are responsible for the production of prostaglandins that cause pain and inflammation. It is effective for reducing pain, swelling, and stiffness in joints and muscles, but long-term use may cause gastrointestinal problems or increase the risk of heart-related issues.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg 2 to 3 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Diabex Tablets
description: Diabex Tablets contain metformin, a medication commonly used to treat type 2 diabetes. Metformin works by decreasing glucose production in the liver, increasing insulin sensitivity, and improving the uptake of glucose by muscles. It helps to lower blood sugar levels and is usually prescribed as part of a comprehensive diabetes management plan. Diabex is considered a first-line treatment for type 2 diabetes and may be combined with other medications when necessary. Metformin does not cause weight gain and is less likely to cause low blood sugar (hypoglycemia).

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 500 mg once or twice daily, increase as needed to 2000-2500 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Dapsone 25mg Tablets
description: Dapsone is an antibiotic and anti-inflammatory drug used primarily for the treatment of leprosy, dermatitis herpetiformis, and certain types of pneumonia. Dapsone works by inhibiting the synthesis of folic acid in bacteria, thereby preventing their growth and replication. It is also used as part of a combination therapy for malaria and in the treatment of autoimmune diseases like pemphigus vulgaris. Dapsone can cause side effects such as hemolytic anemia, especially in individuals with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg to 100 mg daily, depending on the condition being treated
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Depakote 500mg Tablets
description: Depakote (valproic acid) is an anticonvulsant and mood-stabilizing medication used to treat seizure disorders, bipolar disorder, and migraine prevention. It works by increasing the levels of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain, which helps to stabilize electrical activity and reduce seizures. Depakote is also used to manage manic episodes in bipolar disorder and to prevent migraines. Long-term use requires monitoring due to potential side effects, including liver toxicity and weight gain.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 500 mg daily, adjust based on clinical response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Drotaverine Tablets
description: Drotaverine is an antispasmodic medication used to relieve smooth muscle spasms in the gastrointestinal tract, genitourinary tract, and biliary tract. It is commonly used for conditions such as irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), dysmenorrhea (painful menstruation), and renal colic. Drotaverine works by inhibiting phosphodiesterase, which leads to muscle relaxation and reduced cramping. It is often used in combination with other drugs for pain relief during spasms. Drotaverine is generally well-tolerated but may cause mild side effects such as dizziness or nausea.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet 2-3 times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Divalproex Sodium Capsules
description: Divalproex Sodium is an anticonvulsant and mood-stabilizing drug used to treat epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and to prevent migraines. It works by increasing the levels of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain, which helps to reduce abnormal electrical activity and stabilize mood. It is often prescribed for managing seizure disorders, manic episodes in bipolar disorder, and migraine prevention. Divalproex can have side effects like weight gain, hair loss, and liver toxicity, so liver function should be monitored during treatment.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 250 mg 1-2 times daily, increasing as necessary up to 1000-2000 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Dorzolamide Eye Drops
description: Dorzolamide is a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor used as eye drops to treat glaucoma and ocular hypertension. It works by reducing the production of fluid inside the eye, thus lowering intraocular pressure. By reducing pressure within the eye, dorzolamide helps prevent damage to the optic nerve, which can lead to vision loss if left untreated. It is often used in combination with other medications for better control of intraocular pressure. Common side effects include eye irritation or taste disturbance.
sideEffects: Burning or stinging sensation in the eyes

recommendedDosage.adults: Instill 1 drop in the affected eye(s) twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Daflon 1000mg Tablets
description: Daflon is a flavonoid-based medication used to treat venous insufficiency and hemorrhoidal disease. It helps to strengthen the walls of veins and improve blood circulation. Daflon is commonly used for conditions such as varicose veins, leg swelling, and hemorrhoids. It works by improving venous tone and reducing capillary fragility. It is often used to alleviate symptoms like pain, heaviness, and swelling in the legs, as well as reduce bleeding and discomfort associated with hemorrhoids.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet twice daily, preferably with meals
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Diclofenac Potassium Tablets
description: Diclofenac Potassium is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain and reduce inflammation in conditions such as arthritis, muscle pain, and acute injuries. It works by blocking the production of prostaglandins, which are chemicals in the body responsible for pain and inflammation. It is effective for treating acute pain, including conditions like gout, and is faster acting compared to diclofenac sodium due to its potassium salt form. Side effects include gastrointestinal irritation, kidney issues, and increased cardiovascular risk.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg 2 to 3 times daily, depending on the severity of pain
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Dronedarone Tablets
description: Dronedarone is a class III antiarrhythmic drug used to treat atrial fibrillation (AF) and atrial flutter, conditions that cause irregular heart rhythms. It works by stabilizing the electrical activity in the heart, thereby helping to restore a normal rhythm. Dronedarone is generally used to reduce the risk of hospitalization due to AF and prevent recurrence of arrhythmias. It should be used cautiously in patients with heart failure due to potential risks of worsening the condition.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for use in children

name: Dexamethasone Oral Tablets
description: Dexamethasone is a corticosteroid medication used to treat a variety of inflammatory and autoimmune conditions, such as arthritis, allergies, and skin diseases. It works by suppressing the immune system and reducing inflammation. Dexamethasone is also used to treat conditions like asthma, multiple sclerosis flare-ups, and certain types of cancers. While effective, long-term use of dexamethasone can lead to side effects such as weight gain, osteoporosis, and increased risk of infections. It should be used with caution and under medical supervision.

recommendedDosage.adults: Dose varies depending on the condition, typically starting at 0.75 mg to 9 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Econazole Topical
description: Econazole is an antifungal medication used topically to treat a variety of fungal infections, such as athlete's foot, ringworm, and jock itch. It works by interfering with the cell membrane of the fungus, causing it to break down and ultimately kill the organism. Econazole is typically applied to the affected area once or twice a day, depending on the severity of the infection. Side effects can include skin irritation or allergic reactions at the application site.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply to the affected area once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Econopred® (Prednisolone Ophthalmic)
description: Econopred® is a corticosteroid eye drop used to treat inflammation in the eyes, such as conjunctivitis or uveitis. It reduces swelling, redness, and irritation in the eyes by inhibiting the release of substances that cause inflammation. Econopred® is commonly prescribed after eye surgeries or injuries to help prevent inflammation. Prolonged use may lead to increased intraocular pressure or cataract formation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 drops in the affected eye(s) 2 to 4 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Eculizumab Injection
description: Eculizumab is a monoclonal antibody used to treat rare and serious conditions, such as paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) and atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS). It works by inhibiting the complement system, a part of the immune system that contributes to inflammation and cell damage. By blocking this pathway, eculizumab helps prevent the destruction of red blood cells and organ damage in these conditions. It is typically administered intravenously in a hospital or clinic setting.

recommendedDosage.adults: Administer 600 mg initially, followed by 600 mg every week for 4 weeks, then 600 mg every 2 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edaravone Injection
description: Edaravone is an antioxidant medication used primarily to treat amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), a progressive neurodegenerative disease. It works by reducing oxidative stress in the brain, which is believed to contribute to neuronal damage in ALS. Edaravone is typically administered via intravenous injection, and its use may help slow the progression of ALS symptoms. Side effects may include bruising, gait disturbances, and allergic reactions.

recommendedDosage.adults: Administer 60 mg daily for 14 days, followed by 14 days off
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edaravone Oral
description: Edaravone Oral is an antioxidant used to treat ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis) and other neurodegenerative diseases. It is believed to protect the neurons by reducing oxidative stress, thereby slowing the progression of ALS. The oral formulation allows for easier administration, although it is typically prescribed after intravenous edaravone for ongoing management. Potential side effects include gastrointestinal disturbances and headache.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edarbi® (Azilsartan)
description: Edarbi® is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). By blocking the action of angiotensin II, a hormone that constricts blood vessels, it helps to relax and widen the blood vessels, thus lowering blood pressure. This can reduce the risk of stroke, heart attack, and kidney problems. Azilsartan is typically prescribed as part of a comprehensive treatment plan for hypertension, often in combination with other antihypertensive agents.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 40 mg once daily, can be increased to 80 mg daily if necessary
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edarbyclor® (Azilsartan and Chlorthalidone)
description: Edarbyclor® is a combination medication containing azilsartan, an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB), and chlorthalidone, a thiazide-like diuretic. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) by combining the benefits of both medications. Azilsartan relaxes blood vessels, while chlorthalidone helps the kidneys remove excess salt and water, thus lowering blood pressure. This combination improves blood pressure control in patients who require two medications for effective hypertension management.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet daily, may adjust based on patient response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edecrin® (Ethacrynic Acid)
description: Edecrin® is a loop diuretic used to treat edema (fluid retention) caused by heart failure, kidney disease, or liver disease. It works by preventing the kidneys from reabsorbing sodium, chloride, and water, thus increasing urine output and reducing swelling. Ethacrynic acid is typically prescribed when other diuretics are not effective or appropriate due to kidney issues or allergies to sulfonamides. Potential side effects include electrolyte imbalances, dehydration, and hypotension.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 25-50 mg once daily, adjust as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edex® (Alprostadil Urogenital)
description: Edex® is a medication used for the treatment of erectile dysfunction (ED). It contains alprostadil, a synthetic form of prostaglandin E1, which helps to relax blood vessels and improve blood flow to the penis. Alprostadil is typically administered via an intracavernosal injection, which directly delivers the drug to the penis, leading to an erection. It may also be used in some cases of erectile dysfunction when oral medications are ineffective.
formula: Alprostadil 10 mcg, 20 mcg, 40 mcg per injection

recommendedDosage.adults: Inject 10 mcg to 40 mcg into the corpus cavernosum 5-10 minutes before sexual activity
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edluar® (Zolpidem)
description: Edluar® is a brand of zolpidem, a sedative-hypnotic medication used to treat insomnia. It works by affecting the gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) receptors in the brain, which help to induce sleep. Edluar® is taken sublingually (under the tongue) and is designed for rapid absorption. This formulation is effective for individuals who have difficulty falling asleep, but should not be used for long-term sleep issues due to the risk of dependence and tolerance.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg to 10 mg taken immediately before bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edoxaban
description: Edoxaban is an oral anticoagulant (blood thinner) used to prevent and treat blood clots. It works by inhibiting factor Xa, a key enzyme in the blood clotting process. Edoxaban is typically prescribed for conditions such as atrial fibrillation, deep vein thrombosis (DVT), or pulmonary embolism. It reduces the risk of stroke and other complications associated with blood clotting disorders, but can increase the risk of bleeding.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg once daily, may be adjusted for renal function
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Edurant® (Rilpivirine)
description: Edurant® is an antiretroviral medication used in the treatment of HIV (human immunodeficiency virus). It is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) that works by blocking the reverse transcriptase enzyme, which is crucial for HIV replication. When used in combination with other antiretrovirals, it helps to reduce the viral load and maintain undetectable levels of HIV. Edurant® is often part of a combination regimen in HIV-infected individuals.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg once daily with food
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: EES® (Erythromycin)
description: EES® is an antibiotic formulation containing erythromycin, a macrolide antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis, which stops bacterial growth and replication. EES® is commonly prescribed for respiratory infections, skin infections, and certain sexually transmitted diseases. It is available in both oral and topical formulations, as well as injectable forms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg to 500 mg every 6 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Efavirenz
description: Efavirenz is an antiretroviral medication used as part of a combination therapy to treat HIV. It is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI) that helps prevent the virus from replicating by blocking the reverse transcriptase enzyme. Efavirenz is often used in combination with other HIV medications to maintain undetectable viral loads in HIV-positive individuals. It is typically taken once daily, but may cause side effects such as dizziness or vivid dreams.

recommendedDosage.adults: 600 mg once daily, usually at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Efavirenz, Emtricitabine, and Tenofovir
description: This combination medication is used for the treatment of HIV infection. Efavirenz is a non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI), emtricitabine is a nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NRTI), and tenofovir is also an NRTI. Together, they work to inhibit different stages of the HIV replication cycle, helping to reduce viral load and prevent the spread of the virus. This combination therapy is commonly prescribed as part of a long-term HIV treatment regimen.
formula: Efavirenz 600 mg, Emtricitabine 200 mg, Tenofovir 300 mg tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once daily, preferably at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Efavirenz, Lamivudine, and Tenofovir
description: This combination medication is used for the treatment of HIV. Efavirenz is an NNRTI, while lamivudine and tenofovir are NRTIs. These three drugs work together to inhibit different stages of HIV replication, preventing the virus from multiplying and spreading. This combination is often used as part of a first-line treatment regimen for HIV-infected individuals. It is typically taken once daily.
formula: Efavirenz 600 mg, Lamivudine 300 mg, Tenofovir 300 mg tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Efinaconazole Topical
description: Efinaconazole is an antifungal medication used to treat onychomycosis (fungal nail infections). It is a topical solution applied directly to the affected nails to help eliminate the infection. Efinaconazole works by inhibiting the growth of the fungus, preventing its spread. It is generally well-tolerated but may cause skin irritation or burning sensations in some patients. Efinaconazole is considered effective in treating mild to moderate cases of nail fungus.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply once daily to the affected nails
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Eflornithine
description: Eflornithine is a medication primarily used to treat excessive facial hair growth (hirsutism) in women. It works by inhibiting an enzyme called ornithine decarboxylase, which is involved in the growth of hair follicles. Eflornithine is applied topically as a cream and can slow the growth of new facial hair, though it does not remove existing hair. It is also used in the treatment of African sleeping sickness caused by the parasite Trypanosoma brucei.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer of cream to the affected area twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Efudex® Cream (Fluorouracil Topical)
description: Efudex® Cream is a topical chemotherapy medication used to treat pre-cancerous skin conditions, such as actinic keratosis, and certain types of skin cancer. It contains fluorouracil, a drug that interferes with the growth of abnormal skin cells. The cream is applied directly to the affected areas and works by inhibiting the DNA synthesis of rapidly dividing cells, helping to treat the lesions. It may cause redness, peeling, or irritation at the application site.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Efudex® Solution (Fluorouracil Topical)
description: Efudex® Solution is a topical medication that contains fluorouracil, a chemotherapy drug used to treat actinic keratosis and basal cell carcinoma. Like the cream, it works by disrupting the growth of abnormal skin cells. This liquid formulation is applied to affected areas on the skin and may be more suitable for larger areas or for areas with finer skin. Common side effects include skin irritation, redness, and ulceration.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply to the affected area once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elacestrant
description: Elacestrant is a selective estrogen receptor degrader (SERD) used in the treatment of hormone receptor-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women. It works by binding to the estrogen receptor and causing its degradation, thus reducing the effects of estrogen on the cancer cells. Elacestrant is used as a treatment for breast cancer that is resistant to other therapies.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elafibranor
description: Elafibranor is an investigational drug being studied for the treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), a liver disease associated with obesity, diabetes, and metabolic syndrome. It is a peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor alpha/delta (PPARα/δ) agonist that works by improving liver function and reducing fat accumulation in the liver.

recommendedDosage.adults: 80 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elagolix
description: Elagolix is an oral medication used to treat endometriosis and uterine fibroids by reducing the production of estrogen. It is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) antagonist that works by inhibiting the release of hormones that stimulate ovarian estrogen production. Elagolix helps to alleviate pain and other symptoms associated with endometriosis and fibroids.

recommendedDosage.adults: 150 mg once daily for endometriosis, 200 mg for fibroids
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elagolix, Estradiol, and Norethindrone
description: This combination medication is used for the treatment of moderate to severe endometriosis. It contains elagolix (a GnRH antagonist), estradiol (an estrogen), and norethindrone (a progestin). Together, they work by suppressing ovarian estrogen production, relieving pain, and preventing further tissue growth related to endometriosis. Estradiol and norethindrone are included to mitigate the side effects of elagolix, such as bone density loss and menopausal symptoms.
formula: Elagolix 150 mg, Estradiol 1 mg, Norethindrone 0.5 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elahere® (Mirvetuximab soravtansine-gynx Injection)
description: Elahere® is an FDA-approved medication used for the treatment of ovarian cancer. It is a targeted therapy that combines an antibody (mirvetuximab) with a chemotherapy drug, soravtansine. The antibody targets folate receptor alpha (FRα), a protein that is overexpressed in many ovarian cancer cells. Once the drug binds to the cancer cell, the chemotherapy component is delivered directly to the tumor, reducing side effects associated with traditional chemotherapy.

recommendedDosage.adults: 6 mg/kg once every 3 weeks as an intravenous infusion
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elavil® (Amitriptyline)
description: Elavil® is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used primarily to treat depression, anxiety disorders, and certain types of chronic pain. It works by increasing the levels of neurotransmitters like serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, which help to elevate mood and relieve pain. Elavil® can also be used for insomnia and migraine prevention. However, it may cause drowsiness and other side effects, so it should be used cautiously.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg to 150 mg daily, depending on condition
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Electrolyte Injection
description: Electrolyte injections are used to restore or maintain the balance of essential electrolytes (such as sodium, potassium, chloride, and calcium) in the body, particularly in cases of dehydration or electrolyte imbalance. These injections are often administered to patients who have severe dehydration, vomiting, diarrhea, or other conditions that cause an electrolyte imbalance.
formula: Various electrolytes (sodium chloride, potassium chloride, calcium chloride, magnesium sulfate)

recommendedDosage.adults: Dose varies depending on individual requirements
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elderberry Extract
description: Elderberry extract is derived from the elderberry plant and is commonly used as a natural remedy to help alleviate symptoms of colds, flu, and other viral infections. It is rich in antioxidants, particularly flavonoids, which are believed to support the immune system and reduce inflammation. Some studies suggest that elderberry extract can reduce the severity and duration of cold and flu symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300-500 mg 2-3 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elidel® (Pimecrolimus Cream)
description: Elidel® is a topical immunosuppressant used to treat eczema (atopic dermatitis). It works by inhibiting the production of certain inflammatory substances in the skin, helping to reduce redness, itching, and irritation. Elidel® is generally used when other treatments (such as topical steroids) are not effective or appropriate.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elmiron® (Pentosan Polysulfate Sodium)
description: Elmiron® is an oral medication used primarily for the treatment of interstitial cystitis, a chronic bladder condition. It works by coating the bladder wall, which helps protect it from irritants that may cause pain, urgency, and frequency of urination. Elmiron® is also sometimes used for other conditions involving inflammation of the bladder.
formula: Pentosan polysulfate sodium 100 mg oral capsule

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg three times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elvanse® (Lisdexamfetamine Dimesylate)
description: Elvanse® is a central nervous system stimulant used primarily to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and binge eating disorder. It works by affecting the levels of certain neurotransmitters in the brain, such as dopamine and norepinephrine, which helps to increase attention, focus, and impulse control.
formula: Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate 30 mg, 50 mg, 70 mg oral capsule

recommendedDosage.adults: 30 mg once daily in the morning
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Eloxatin® (Oxaliplatin Injection)
description: Eloxatin® is a chemotherapy medication used to treat various types of cancer, including colorectal cancer. It is part of a class of drugs known as platinum-based chemotherapy agents, which work by interfering with the DNA of cancer cells, preventing them from dividing and growing. Eloxatin® is typically given as an intravenous infusion in combination with other chemotherapy medications.

recommendedDosage.adults: 85 mg/m² as an intravenous infusion every 2 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Erythrocin® (Erythromycin)
description: Erythrocin® is an antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections, including respiratory infections, skin infections, and gastrointestinal infections. It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis, preventing the bacteria from growing and multiplying. Erythromycin is also used as an alternative to penicillin in patients who are allergic to penicillin.
formula: Erythromycin 250 mg, 500 mg oral tablet, 1% topical ointment

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg to 500 mg every 6-12 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Erythromycin Topical
description: Erythromycin topical is used to treat acne and other skin infections caused by bacteria. It works by preventing the bacteria from growing and spreading. The topical form is applied directly to the affected area, usually once or twice daily. It is effective in reducing acne lesions and promoting clearer skin.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply to the affected area twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Erythromycin Ophthalmic Ointment
description: Erythromycin ophthalmic ointment is used to treat bacterial eye infections, such as conjunctivitis (pink eye) and other ocular infections. It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis, preventing bacterial growth. The ointment is applied directly to the infected eye, typically 1-2 times a day depending on the severity of the infection.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a small amount to the affected eye 1-2 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Erythema Ointment
description: Erythema ointment is a topical treatment used to reduce redness and irritation caused by various skin conditions, such as inflammation, sunburn, and allergic reactions. The ointment works by soothing the skin and reducing inflammation in the affected areas, promoting faster healing.
formula: Various active ingredients (e.g., hydrocortisone, calamine, or aloe vera) in a topical base

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area 1-2 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Esbriet® (Pirfenidone)
description: Esbriet® is a medication used to treat idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), a condition where the lungs become scarred and lose their ability to transfer oxygen into the bloodstream. Pirfenidone, the active ingredient, works by reducing the production of certain proteins that cause fibrosis (scarring) in the lungs. This helps to slow the progression of the disease and improve lung function.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 267 mg three times a day and increase to 801 mg three times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Escitalopram
description: Escitalopram is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used primarily to treat depression, anxiety, and panic disorders. It works by increasing the levels of serotonin, a neurotransmitter in the brain that helps regulate mood. Escitalopram helps alleviate symptoms of anxiety and depression, improving the overall quality of life.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily, can increase up to 20 mg daily if necessary
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Esomeprazole Magnesium
description: Esomeprazole magnesium is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome. It works by reducing the amount of stomach acid produced, helping to prevent acid reflux, heartburn, and stomach ulcers.
formula: Esomeprazole magnesium 20 mg, 40 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 40 mg once daily before a meal
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Eszopiclone
description: Eszopiclone is a medication used to treat insomnia. It belongs to a class of drugs known as sedative-hypnotics, which work by affecting the brain's GABA receptors, promoting relaxation and sleep. Eszopiclone helps people fall asleep faster and stay asleep longer without feeling drowsy the next day.
formula: Eszopiclone 1 mg, 2 mg, 3 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 mg to 3 mg taken once nightly before bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Etanercept Injection
description: Etanercept is a biologic medication used to treat autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, and ankylosing spondylitis. It works by inhibiting tumor necrosis factor (TNF), a protein involved in inflammatory responses, reducing inflammation, pain, and damage caused by these conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg once a week or 25 mg twice a week depending on condition
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Etizolam Tablets
description: Etizolam is a medication used for anxiety, panic disorders, and insomnia. It belongs to a class of drugs known as thienodiazepines, which act on the central nervous system to produce calming effects. Etizolam is used to reduce anxiety symptoms and help with sleep disturbances.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.5 mg to 1 mg taken once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Etonogestrel Implant
description: Etonogestrel implant is a long-acting reversible contraceptive method. It is a small, flexible rod implanted under the skin of the upper arm that releases the hormone etonogestrel, which prevents ovulation. It is effective for up to three years in preventing pregnancy.

recommendedDosage.adults: One implant inserted under the skin of the upper arm, effective for 3 years
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Excedrin® (Acetaminophen, Aspirin, and Caffeine)
description: Excedrin® is a combination medication used for the relief of headaches, including tension and migraine headaches. It combines acetaminophen (a pain reliever), aspirin (an anti-inflammatory), and caffeine (which enhances the effects of pain relievers and constricts blood vessels). This combination helps relieve headache pain and reduce associated symptoms like nausea.
formula: Acetaminophen 250 mg, Aspirin 250 mg, Caffeine 65 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 2 tablets every 6 hours as needed, not exceeding 8 tablets in 24 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Exemestane
description: Exemestane is an aromatase inhibitor used to treat hormone-receptor-positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women. It works by decreasing the amount of estrogen in the body, which may help slow or stop the growth of certain types of breast cancer cells that rely on estrogen to grow.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg once daily after a meal
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Exforge® (Amlodipine and Valsartan)
description: Exforge® is a combination medication used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). It combines amlodipine, a calcium channel blocker, and valsartan, an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB), to lower blood pressure by relaxing blood vessels and improving blood flow.
formula: Amlodipine 5 mg, 10 mg and Valsartan 80 mg, 160 mg oral tablet
sideEffects: Swelling of the ankles or feet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Exelon® (Rivastigmine)
description: Exelon® is a medication used to treat Alzheimer's disease and Parkinson's disease dementia. Rivastigmine, the active ingredient, works by inhibiting the breakdown of acetylcholine, a neurotransmitter important for memory and cognitive function. By increasing acetylcholine levels, it helps improve symptoms related to cognitive decline and memory problems.
formula: Rivastigmine 1.5 mg, 3 mg, 4.5 mg, 6 mg oral capsule; Rivastigmine 4.6 mg, 9.5 mg, 13.3 mg transdermal patch

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 1.5 mg twice daily, gradually increasing to 6 mg twice daily if tolerated
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Excedrin Migraine
description: Excedrin Migraine is a combination medication used for the relief of migraine headaches. It contains acetaminophen (a pain reliever), aspirin (an anti-inflammatory), and caffeine (which enhances the effectiveness of pain relievers). It works by reducing pain and inflammation and constricting blood vessels, which can alleviate migraine symptoms.
formula: Acetaminophen 250 mg, Aspirin 250 mg, Caffeine 65 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 2 tablets at the onset of migraine, may repeat every 6 hours as needed, not exceeding 8 tablets in 24 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elderflower Extract
description: Elderflower extract is derived from the flowers of the elderberry plant, commonly used for its anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and immune-boosting properties. It is commonly used in herbal medicine to treat colds, flu, and respiratory conditions like sinusitis and bronchitis. Elderflower extract is thought to support the body's immune system and help reduce symptoms associated with respiratory infections.
formula: Elderflower extract 300 mg to 600 mg per dose (standardized extract)

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg to 600 mg daily, can be divided into 1 to 2 doses
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Elavil® (Amitriptyline)
description: Elavil® (Amitriptyline) is a tricyclic antidepressant used to treat depression, anxiety, chronic pain, and insomnia. It works by increasing the levels of neurotransmitters (serotonin and norepinephrine) in the brain, which help improve mood and reduce pain. It is often used off-label for chronic pain syndromes, including migraines, fibromyalgia, and nerve pain.
formula: Amitriptyline 10 mg, 25 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 100 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 25 mg at bedtime, increasing up to 150 mg daily depending on response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fexofenadine Tablets
description: Fexofenadine is an antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of seasonal allergies such as runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes, as well as symptoms of chronic urticaria (hives). It works by blocking the effects of histamine, a substance in the body that causes allergic symptoms. Unlike older antihistamines, fexofenadine is less likely to cause drowsiness.
formula: Fexofenadine 30 mg, 60 mg, 120 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg twice daily or 120 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluoxetine Capsules
description: Fluoxetine is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression, anxiety disorders, panic attacks, and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). It works by increasing the levels of serotonin in the brain, which helps improve mood, anxiety, and overall well-being.
formula: Fluoxetine 10 mg, 20 mg, 40 mg oral capsule

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily, may be increased after 4-6 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray
description: Fluticasone propionate is a corticosteroid used to treat symptoms of allergic rhinitis, including nasal congestion, sneezing, and runny nose. It works by reducing inflammation in the nasal passages, helping to relieve congestion and other allergic symptoms. It can also be used to treat non-allergic rhinitis.
sideEffects: Dryness in the nose or throat

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 spray in each nostril once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Furosemide Tablets
description: Furosemide is a diuretic (water pill) used to treat fluid retention (edema) associated with heart failure, liver disease, and kidney disease. It works by helping the kidneys remove excess salt and water from the body, reducing swelling and fluid buildup.
formula: Furosemide 20 mg, 40 mg, 80 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 80 mg daily, can be adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Famotidine Tablets
description: Famotidine is an H2 blocker used to treat conditions related to excess stomach acid, such as heartburn, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and stomach ulcers. It works by reducing the amount of acid the stomach produces, which helps prevent irritation and ulcers.
formula: Famotidine 10 mg, 20 mg, 40 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 40 mg once daily, typically taken at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluconazole Capsules
description: Fluconazole is an antifungal medication used to treat infections caused by fungi, including yeast infections (e.g., vaginal candidiasis) and fungal infections in the mouth (thrush) or systemic infections. It works by inhibiting the growth of fungi by interfering with their cell membrane synthesis.
formula: Fluconazole 50 mg, 100 mg, 200 mg oral capsule

recommendedDosage.adults: 150 mg as a single dose for vaginal candidiasis; 200 mg to 400 mg for systemic infections
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Ferrous Sulfate Tablets
description: Ferrous sulfate is a form of iron used to treat or prevent iron deficiency anemia. Iron is an essential mineral that helps produce red blood cells and transport oxygen in the body. Ferrous sulfate supplements help replenish iron stores and improve oxygen delivery to tissues.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 tablets daily, typically taken with food
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Folic Acid Tablets
description: Folic acid is a B-vitamin (B9) used to treat or prevent folate deficiency, which can lead to anemia. It is especially important for pregnant women to prevent neural tube defects in the developing fetus. Folic acid also supports red blood cell production and is essential for DNA synthesis.
formula: Folic acid 400 mcg, 800 mcg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mcg daily for general health, 600 mcg to 800 mcg during pregnancy
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluconazole Oral Suspension
description: Fluconazole oral suspension is a liquid form of the antifungal medication used to treat fungal infections such as thrush, vaginal yeast infections, and other systemic fungal infections. It works by inhibiting fungal cell membrane synthesis, which prevents fungal growth.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg to 400 mg for systemic infections, single 150 mg dose for vaginal candidiasis
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fentanyl Transdermal Patch
description: Fentanyl is a powerful opioid analgesic used for the management of severe pain, particularly in cancer patients or those with chronic pain. The transdermal patch provides continuous pain relief by releasing fentanyl slowly through the skin over 72 hours.
formula: Fentanyl 12 mcg/hr, 25 mcg/hr, 50 mcg/hr, 75 mcg/hr, 100 mcg/hr transdermal patch

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply 1 patch every 72 hours, dosage adjusted based on pain control needs
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluoxetine Oral Solution
description: Fluoxetine oral solution is a liquid form of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat major depressive disorder, panic attacks, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). It works by increasing the levels of serotonin in the brain, improving mood and overall mental well-being.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily, may be increased after 4-6 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluticasone Propionate Cream
description: Fluticasone propionate cream is a topical corticosteroid used to treat inflammatory skin conditions, such as eczema, dermatitis, and allergic reactions. It works by reducing inflammation, redness, and itching on the skin. It helps in conditions where the skin is irritated and inflamed due to allergic reactions or other factors.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fexofenadine Oral Suspension
description: Fexofenadine oral suspension is a liquid antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of seasonal allergies, such as runny nose, sneezing, itchy eyes, and hives. It is a non-drowsy medication that blocks the effects of histamine, reducing allergic reactions without causing significant sedation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg twice daily or 120 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluconazole Injection
description: Fluconazole injection is an antifungal medication used to treat serious fungal infections such as cryptococcal meningitis, systemic candidiasis, and other fungal infections. It works by inhibiting the synthesis of ergosterol, a critical component of fungal cell membranes, preventing fungal growth and replication.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg to 400 mg once daily, depending on the infection
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Furosemide Injection
description: Furosemide injection is a diuretic used to treat fluid retention (edema) associated with conditions like heart failure, liver disease, and kidney disease. It works by promoting the elimination of excess salt and water from the body through the kidneys, reducing swelling and fluid buildup.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 40 mg once, may be repeated as necessary
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Famotidine Oral Suspension
description: Famotidine oral suspension is an H2 blocker used to treat conditions related to excess stomach acid, such as GERD, ulcers, and heartburn. It works by blocking the action of histamine on the stomach, reducing acid production and relieving symptoms of acid reflux and indigestion.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 40 mg once daily, typically taken at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluoxetine Tablets
description: Fluoxetine tablets are a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat major depression, anxiety disorders, panic attacks, and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). It works by increasing serotonin levels in the brain, improving mood, anxiety, and overall well-being.
formula: Fluoxetine 10 mg, 20 mg, 40 mg oral tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily, may be increased after 4-6 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluticasone Propionate Inhaler
description: Fluticasone propionate inhaler is a corticosteroid used to prevent asthma attacks and manage chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It works by reducing inflammation in the airways, making breathing easier and reducing symptoms such as wheezing and shortness of breath.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 inhalation twice daily, can be adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fentanyl Buccal Tablet
description: Fentanyl buccal tablets are used for the management of breakthrough pain in cancer patients who are already on opioid therapy. Fentanyl is a potent opioid analgesic, and the buccal tablet is absorbed through the lining of the mouth, providing rapid relief from severe pain.
formula: Fentanyl 100 mcg, 200 mcg, 400 mcg, 600 mcg, 800 mcg buccal tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet every 4 hours as needed for breakthrough pain
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Fluconazole Topical Cream
description: Fluconazole topical cream is used to treat fungal skin infections such as athlete's foot, ringworm, and vaginal yeast infections. It works by inhibiting the synthesis of ergosterol, an essential component of fungal cell membranes, which prevents the fungi from growing.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Ferrous Sulfate Oral Solution
description: Ferrous sulfate oral solution is an iron supplement used to treat or prevent iron deficiency anemia. Iron is essential for the production of hemoglobin, which helps carry oxygen throughout the body. This liquid form is ideal for individuals who have difficulty swallowing tablets.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 teaspoons once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Folic Acid Oral Solution
description: Folic acid oral solution is used to prevent and treat folate deficiency, which can lead to anemia. It is particularly useful in pregnancy and for individuals with conditions that impair folate absorption.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 teaspoons daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluoxetine Capsules (Delayed Release)
description: Fluoxetine delayed-release capsules are used to treat conditions like depression, anxiety, and OCD. They work by increasing serotonin levels in the brain to help improve mood and emotional stability. The delayed-release formulation ensures a steady release of medication throughout the day.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40 mg once daily in the morning, can increase to 60 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluticasone Propionate Lotion
description: Fluticasone propionate lotion is a topical corticosteroid used for the treatment of skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis. It reduces inflammation, redness, and itching. The lotion is specifically formulated for ease of application and absorption.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply once or twice daily to the affected area
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fexofenadine Capsules
description: Fexofenadine is an antihistamine used to treat allergic rhinitis (hay fever) and urticaria (hives). It works by blocking histamine receptors, which helps reduce symptoms like sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes. It is a non-drowsy formulation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg twice daily or 180 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluconazole Tablets
description: Fluconazole tablets are used to treat fungal infections, including yeast infections, thrush, and systemic fungal infections. It works by inhibiting the growth of fungi, providing effective treatment for a wide range of fungal conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg to 400 mg once daily depending on infection
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Furosemide Oral Solution
description: Furosemide is a diuretic used to treat fluid retention and swelling caused by conditions such as heart failure, liver disease, and kidney disease. It helps reduce edema and lowers blood pressure by increasing urine output.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 80 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Famotidine Injection
description: Famotidine injection is used to treat conditions such as ulcers, acid reflux, and conditions where excess stomach acid is produced. It works by blocking histamine receptors in the stomach lining, reducing acid production and alleviating symptoms of acid-related conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 40 mg once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluoxetine Oral Suspension (Sugar-Free)
description: Fluoxetine oral suspension is a liquid form of fluoxetine, used to treat depression, anxiety disorders, and OCD. The sugar-free formulation is ideal for individuals with diabetes or those who need to avoid sugar. It works by increasing serotonin levels in the brain to improve mood and behavior.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily, can increase up to 80 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Drops
description: Fluticasone propionate nasal drops are used to treat allergic rhinitis and other nasal allergies by reducing inflammation in the nasal passages. The medication helps relieve symptoms such as congestion, sneezing, and a runny nose.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 sprays in each nostril once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fentanyl Sublingual Tablet
description: Fentanyl sublingual tablet is a potent opioid analgesic used to manage breakthrough cancer pain in patients who are already on opioid therapy for chronic pain. It works by binding to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, providing rapid pain relief. The sublingual tablet dissolves under the tongue for quick absorption.
formula: Fentanyl 100 mcg, 200 mcg, 400 mcg, 600 mcg, 800 mcg per tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet every 4 hours as needed for breakthrough pain, consult a doctor for dosage adjustments
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended

name: Fluconazole Vaginal Cream
description: Fluconazole vaginal cream is an antifungal medication used to treat vaginal yeast infections caused by Candida species. It works by inhibiting fungal cell membrane synthesis, preventing the growth of the yeast. The cream is applied directly into the vagina to relieve symptoms like itching, burning, and discharge.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply the cream once daily for up to 7 days, depending on severity
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Ferrous Sulfate Chewable Tablets
description: Ferrous sulfate chewable tablets are used to treat or prevent iron deficiency anemia. These tablets provide a convenient and pleasant-tasting form of iron supplementation. Iron is essential for the production of hemoglobin in red blood cells, which helps carry oxygen to tissues throughout the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Folic Acid Injection
description: Folic acid injection is used to treat or prevent folate deficiency, which can lead to anemia. It is commonly used in patients with malabsorption syndromes, certain medications that interfere with folate metabolism, or during pregnancy to prevent neural tube defects. Folic acid is essential for the production of red blood cells and the proper functioning of the nervous system.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 5 mg daily depending on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluoxetine Delayed-Release Capsules
description: Fluoxetine delayed-release capsules are used for the treatment of depression, anxiety disorders, and obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). The delayed-release formulation ensures a steady release of medication, which can help improve mood and reduce symptoms over time. It works by increasing the amount of serotonin in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40 mg once daily in the morning, can be increased to 80 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Gel
description: Fluticasone propionate nasal gel is a corticosteroid used to treat allergic rhinitis, reducing symptoms like nasal congestion, sneezing, and runny nose. The gel formulation is designed for easier application and longer-lasting effects. It works by reducing inflammation in the nasal passages.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 sprays in each nostril once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fexofenadine Extended-Release Tablets
description: Fexofenadine extended-release tablets are an antihistamine used to treat allergic conditions such as hay fever and hives. They provide relief from symptoms like sneezing, itching, and runny nose. The extended-release formulation ensures long-lasting effects throughout the day.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluconazole Oral Suspension (Sugar-Free)
description: Fluconazole oral suspension is an antifungal medication used to treat yeast infections, including oral thrush, vaginal yeast infections, and systemic fungal infections. The sugar-free formulation is ideal for patients who need to manage blood sugar levels. Fluconazole inhibits fungal cell membrane synthesis, stopping the growth of the fungus.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg on the first day, followed by 100 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Furosemide Oral Suspension (Sugar-Free)
description: Furosemide oral suspension is a diuretic used to treat fluid retention caused by conditions such as heart failure, kidney disease, and liver disease. The sugar-free formulation is suitable for diabetics or those avoiding sugar. Furosemide works by helping the kidneys eliminate excess sodium and water from the body.
formula: Furosemide 10 mg/1 mL, sugar-free oral suspension

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 80 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Famotidine Delayed-Release Tablets
description: Famotidine delayed-release tablets are used to treat conditions such as heartburn, acid reflux, and ulcers. The delayed-release formulation ensures prolonged acid suppression, providing longer-lasting relief from symptoms of acid reflux and indigestion.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once or twice daily as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluoxetine Delayed-Release Oral Solution
description: Fluoxetine delayed-release oral solution is used for the treatment of depression, anxiety, and obsessive-compulsive disorder. The delayed-release formulation helps manage the release of fluoxetine in the body, allowing for a more gradual effect and reducing the likelihood of side effects. It works by increasing serotonin levels in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 dose (20 mg) once daily, may increase up to 40 mg daily after 1-2 weeks if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray (Alcohol-Free)
description: Fluticasone propionate nasal spray (alcohol-free) is a corticosteroid used to treat allergic rhinitis symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, and nasal congestion. The alcohol-free formulation is ideal for sensitive patients. It works by reducing inflammation in the nasal passages, thus improving symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 sprays in each nostril once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fentanyl Transdermal System (Matrix)
description: Fentanyl transdermal system (matrix) is a patch used for managing chronic pain in patients who are opioid-tolerant. The patch releases fentanyl over a period of time, providing continuous pain relief. It is applied to the skin and is absorbed transdermally into the bloodstream.
formula: Fentanyl 12 mcg/h, 25 mcg/h, 50 mcg/h, 75 mcg/h, 100 mcg/h patches

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply one patch every 72 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluconazole Injection (Single-Dose Vial)
description: Fluconazole injection is an antifungal medication used to treat systemic fungal infections such as candidiasis, cryptococcal meningitis, and other fungal infections. The single-dose vial formulation provides a convenient way to administer the medication intravenously in a hospital setting.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg to 400 mg intravenously once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Ferrous Sulfate Extended-Release Tablets
description: Ferrous sulfate extended-release tablets are used to treat iron deficiency anemia. The extended-release formulation allows for better absorption and reduced gastrointestinal side effects. Iron is crucial for the production of hemoglobin in red blood cells, which helps oxygen circulate throughout the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Folic Acid Extended-Release Tablets
description: Folic acid extended-release tablets are used to treat or prevent folate deficiency, which can lead to anemia. These tablets provide a steady release of folic acid, essential for red blood cell production and normal cell division. It is particularly important during pregnancy to prevent neural tube defects in the developing fetus.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluoxetine Oral Solution (Alcohol-Free)
description: Fluoxetine oral solution (alcohol-free) is a liquid form of the antidepressant used for treating depression, anxiety, and other mood disorders. This formulation is suitable for patients who prefer a liquid dosage form or have difficulty swallowing tablets. It works by increasing serotonin levels in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 dose (20 mg) once daily, may increase up to 40 mg daily after 1-2 weeks if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fluticasone Propionate Nasal Spray (Alcohol-Free) (Metered)
description: Fluticasone propionate nasal spray (alcohol-free) is used to treat seasonal and perennial allergic rhinitis. The metered-dose spray provides consistent dosing, and the alcohol-free formula is ideal for patients with sensitivities. It reduces inflammation in the nasal passages to relieve symptoms such as congestion, sneezing, and runny nose.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 sprays in each nostril once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Fexofenadine Oral Suspension (Sugar-Free)
description: Fexofenadine oral suspension (sugar-free) is an antihistamine used to relieve symptoms of allergic rhinitis and chronic urticaria (hives). It provides relief from sneezing, runny nose, and itching. The sugar-free formulation is suitable for diabetic patients or those managing blood sugar levels.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 dose (60 mg) twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Flagyl 500mg Tablets
description: Flagyl 500mg Tablets contain metronidazole, an antibiotic and antiprotozoal medication used to treat a variety of infections caused by bacteria and parasites. It is commonly prescribed for conditions such as bacterial vaginosis, gastrointestinal infections, and certain types of skin or respiratory infections. Metronidazole works by inhibiting the growth of bacteria and protozoa. It is also used to treat infections caused by anaerobic bacteria. Flagyl is effective for both acute and chronic infections but can cause side effects like nausea, a metallic taste, and dizziness.
recommendedDosage: 500 mg two or three times daily for 7-10 days, depending on the infection

name: Gravinate Tablets
description: Gravinate Tablets are a combination medication used to treat nausea, vomiting, and dizziness associated with motion sickness, vertigo, and other related conditions. The active ingredient, meclizine, is an antihistamine that works by blocking the action of histamine in the body, which can contribute to nausea and dizziness. It is commonly prescribed for patients who experience symptoms of motion sickness or inner ear problems. Gravinate is also sometimes used for managing nausea during pregnancy (with a doctor's recommendation).
recommendedDosage: 25-50 mg once daily, 1 hour before travel for motion sickness or as directed by a healthcare provider

name: Gabapentin Capsules
description: Gabapentin is a medication primarily used to treat nerve pain (neuropathy), seizures, and restless leg syndrome. It is also prescribed for certain forms of anxiety disorders and as a part of treatment for fibromyalgia. Gabapentin works by affecting the way the brain and nerves transmit messages to the body, helping to calm abnormal electrical activity in the brain and nerve pathways.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 300 mg once daily, gradually increasing up to 1800 mg daily (divided doses)
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gatifloxacin Ophthalmic Solution
description: Gatifloxacin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic used in eye drops to treat bacterial eye infections such as conjunctivitis (pink eye) and corneal ulcers. It works by inhibiting the replication of bacterial DNA, stopping bacteria from growing and spreading. It is effective against a variety of eye infections caused by susceptible bacteria, providing relief from symptoms such as redness, irritation, and discharge.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 drop in the infected eye every 2 hours for the first 2 days, then 1 drop every 4 hours for the next 5 days
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gaviscon Liquid
description: Gaviscon liquid is an over-the-counter medication used to treat heartburn, acid reflux, and indigestion. It works by forming a foam barrier on top of the stomach contents, which prevents acid from reaching the esophagus. This helps relieve the burning sensation in the chest (heartburn) caused by acid reflux. The liquid also neutralizes stomach acid, providing quick relief from symptoms.
formula: Sodium bicarbonate, calcium carbonate, magnesium carbonate, and alginic acid (suspension)

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-20 mL after meals and at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gaviscon Tablets
description: Gaviscon tablets are used to treat heartburn and indigestion caused by acid reflux. Like the liquid form, these tablets help neutralize stomach acid and form a protective barrier on top of the stomach contents. This barrier prevents acid from flowing back into the esophagus, helping to relieve symptoms of heartburn and discomfort after meals.
formula: Sodium bicarbonate, calcium carbonate, and alginic acid (tablet form)

recommendedDosage.adults: 2-4 tablets after meals and at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gemfibrozil Tablets
description: Gemfibrozil is used to lower elevated blood cholesterol and triglyceride levels, which can help reduce the risk of heart disease. It works by increasing the breakdown of fats and lowering the production of triglycerides in the liver. It is particularly effective for patients with high triglyceride levels and low HDL cholesterol (the good cholesterol).

recommendedDosage.adults: 600 mg twice daily, 30 minutes before meals
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gleevec Tablets
description: Gleevec (Imatinib) is a medication used in the treatment of cancers such as chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) and gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs). It works by inhibiting certain enzymes that promote cancer cell growth. Gleevec has significantly improved outcomes for patients with CML, targeting the abnormal proteins responsible for cancer cell proliferation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mg once daily, may be increased up to 800 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glimepiride Tablets
description: Glimepiride is an oral medication used to control blood sugar levels in patients with type 2 diabetes. It stimulates the pancreas to release insulin and improves the body's sensitivity to insulin, helping regulate blood glucose. It is typically used when diet and exercise alone are insufficient for controlling blood sugar levels.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 1-2 mg once daily, may increase up to 8 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glipizide Tablets
description: Glipizide is an oral medication that helps control blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes. It works by stimulating the pancreas to produce more insulin, which helps lower blood glucose. It is used when diet and exercise alone are not enough to manage blood sugar levels.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg once daily, may increase up to 20 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glucagon Injection
description: Glucagon is an emergency medication used to treat severe hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) in diabetic patients. It works by stimulating the liver to release glucose into the bloodstream, rapidly increasing blood sugar levels. It is typically administered when a patient is unconscious or unable to ingest glucose orally.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 mg administered subcutaneously or intramuscularly
recommendedDosage.children: 0.5 mg for children weighing less than 25 kg

name: Glucophage Tablets
description: Glucophage (Metformin) is a commonly prescribed medication for the management of type 2 diabetes. It works by reducing the amount of glucose produced by the liver and improving the body’s sensitivity to insulin, helping regulate blood sugar levels. It is often used as the first-line therapy for type 2 diabetes, especially in overweight patients.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg to 1000 mg twice daily with meals
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glucosamine Sulfate Tablets
description: Glucosamine sulfate is a supplement commonly used to treat osteoarthritis. It is believed to help rebuild cartilage and reduce the pain associated with joint degradation. This compound is naturally found in the body, particularly in the fluid around the joints. As a supplement, it helps to maintain joint health and manage symptoms of osteoarthritis, including pain and stiffness.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg 2-3 times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glutathione Injection
description: Glutathione is a powerful antioxidant that helps protect cells from damage by free radicals and oxidative stress. It is used in various medical treatments to improve liver function, detoxify the body, and support overall cellular health. Glutathione injections are often used in treating conditions like liver disease, cystic fibrosis, and other chronic conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 600 mg once or twice a week, depending on medical guidance
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glyburide Tablets
description: Glyburide is an oral medication used to treat type 2 diabetes by lowering blood sugar levels. It works by stimulating the pancreas to produce more insulin and increasing the effectiveness of insulin in the body. Glyburide is often prescribed when lifestyle changes and diet are insufficient to manage blood sugar levels.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2.5 mg to 5 mg daily, taken with breakfast
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glycopyrrolate Tablets
description: Glycopyrrolate is an anticholinergic drug used to treat various conditions, including excessive drooling in patients with neurological disorders and to reduce the side effects of anesthesia. It works by blocking acetylcholine, a neurotransmitter that can cause excessive secretion and muscle spasms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 mg twice a day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Glyxambi Tablets
description: Glyxambi is a combination medication used to treat type 2 diabetes. It contains two active ingredients: empagliflozin (a sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitor) and linagliptin (a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor). This combination helps lower blood sugar levels by improving insulin sensitivity and reducing glucose reabsorption in the kidneys.

recommendedDosage.adults: One tablet daily, with or without food
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gocovri Capsules
description: Gocovri is used to treat dyskinesia (abnormal, involuntary movements) associated with Parkinson's disease. It contains amantadine, which works by regulating dopamine levels in the brain. Gocovri helps reduce the occurrence of involuntary movements that may result from Parkinson’s disease or treatment with levodopa.

recommendedDosage.adults: 137 mg once daily, typically in the evening
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: GoLYTELY Solution
description: GoLYTELY is a polyethylene glycol solution used for bowel preparation prior to a colonoscopy or other gastrointestinal procedures. It works by inducing diarrhea to clear out the bowels. It helps ensure that the colon is clean for optimal visualization during medical procedures.

recommendedDosage.adults: Drink 240 mL every 10 minutes until 4 liters are consumed, starting the evening before the procedure
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Goserelin Acetate Injection
description: Goserelin acetate is a synthetic hormone used in the treatment of hormone-sensitive cancers, such as prostate cancer and breast cancer, as well as conditions like endometriosis and fibroids. It works by inhibiting the secretion of certain hormones that stimulate cancer cell growth.
formula: Goserelin acetate 3.6 mg or 10.8 mg injection (monthly or every three months)

recommendedDosage.adults: 3.6 mg injection every month or 10.8 mg every 3 months
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Granisetron Injection
description: Granisetron is an antiemetic drug used to prevent nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy or radiation therapy. It works by blocking serotonin receptors in the brain and gut, which helps to reduce the feeling of nausea and prevent vomiting.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 mg injection 30 minutes before chemotherapy, then as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Griseofulvin Tablets
description: Griseofulvin is an antifungal medication used to treat fungal infections of the skin, hair, and nails. It works by inhibiting the growth of fungi, particularly dermatophytes, which cause conditions like ringworm, athlete's foot, and fungal nail infections.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg to 500 mg daily, depending on the infection
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Guaifenesin Syrup
description: Guaifenesin is an expectorant used to help relieve chest congestion caused by respiratory infections, colds, or allergies. It works by thinning and loosening mucus in the airways, clearing congestion, and making breathing easier. The syrup form is typically used for children or adults who have difficulty swallowing tablets.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mL every 4 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Guaifenesin Tablets
description: Guaifenesin tablets are used to relieve chest congestion by thinning and loosening mucus in the airways. This helps make coughing more productive and eases the passage of mucus from the lungs. It is commonly used in the treatment of coughs and colds.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet every 12 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Guanfacine Tablets
description: Guanfacine is used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and high blood pressure. It works by stimulating receptors in the brain that reduce nerve activity, helping improve focus and reduce symptoms of hyperactivity. It also relaxes blood vessels and decreases heart rate.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gvoke HypoPen Injection
description: Gvoke HypoPen is a pre-filled injection used for the emergency treatment of severe hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) in people with diabetes. It contains glucagon, which helps to quickly raise blood sugar levels by stimulating the liver to release glucose into the bloodstream.

recommendedDosage.adults: Inject 1 mg subcutaneously or intramuscularly as needed during severe hypoglycemia
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gaviscon Double Action Liquid
description: Gaviscon Double Action Liquid is used to relieve heartburn and indigestion. It contains two active ingredients: sodium bicarbonate and alginic acid. It works by neutralizing stomach acid and forming a protective barrier that prevents acid reflux into the esophagus.
formula: Sodium bicarbonate 10 mg, alginic acid 250 mg per 10 mL

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-20 mL after meals and before bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gaviscon Double Action Tablets
description: Gaviscon Double Action Tablets are used to treat heartburn and indigestion. They work by neutralizing stomach acid and forming a protective barrier to prevent acid reflux. The tablets are convenient for those who prefer a solid dosage form over liquid alternatives.
formula: Sodium bicarbonate 100 mg, alginic acid 500 mg per tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 tablets after meals and at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Gaviscon Advance Liquid
description: Gaviscon Advance Liquid is an over-the-counter remedy for heartburn, acid reflux, and indigestion. It contains sodium alginate, which forms a gel-like barrier that helps to prevent acid reflux. It is more effective than standard Gaviscon liquid in treating acid reflux symptoms.
formula: Sodium alginate 500 mg, calcium carbonate 200 mg per 10 mL

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-20 mL after meals and at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

description: Gaviscon Tablets Cherry offer heartburn and indigestion relief in a chewable tablet form with a cherry flavor. These tablets neutralize stomach acid and form a protective barrier against acid reflux.
formula: Sodium bicarbonate 100 mg, Alginate 500 mg per tablet
