recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor

name: Haloperidol Tablets
description: Haloperidol Tablets are antipsychotic medications used to treat a variety of mental health conditions, including schizophrenia, acute psychosis, and Tourette's syndrome. They work by altering the effects of dopamine in the brain, which helps reduce symptoms like hallucinations, delusions, and severe agitation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg daily in divided doses
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Hydrochlorothiazide Tablets
description: Hydrochlorothiazide Tablets are diuretics used to treat high blood pressure and fluid retention (edema). They work by helping the kidneys remove excess salt and water from the body, which lowers blood pressure and reduces swelling.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-50 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for dosage instructions

name: Hydrocortisone Cream
description: Hydrocortisone Cream is a topical corticosteroid used to treat skin conditions such as eczema, dermatitis, and rashes. It works by reducing inflammation, redness, and itching caused by these conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area 2-4 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Use under medical supervision

name: Heparin Injection
description: Heparin Injection is an anticoagulant used to prevent and treat blood clots in conditions such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT), pulmonary embolism, and atrial fibrillation. It works by inhibiting the formation of clotting factors in the blood.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5,000-10,000 IU every 4-6 hours via injection
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage to be determined by a physician

name: Hydroxyzine Tablets
description: Hydroxyzine Tablets are antihistamines used to treat anxiety, nausea, vomiting, allergies, and skin conditions like hives. They work by blocking histamine receptors to reduce symptoms such as itching and swelling, and also have a calming effect on the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-50 mg up to 4 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Hydralazine Tablets
description: Hydralazine Tablets are vasodilators used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. They work by relaxing the muscles in blood vessels, allowing blood to flow more easily and reducing strain on the heart.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-50 mg 3-4 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for dosage instructions

name: Hydromorphone Injection
description: Hydromorphone Injection is an opioid analgesic used to relieve moderate to severe pain in medical settings. It works by altering the way the brain and nervous system respond to pain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 mg every 3-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage to be determined by a physician

name: Hydroxychloroquine Tablets
description: Hydroxychloroquine Tablets are used to treat autoimmune diseases like lupus and rheumatoid arthritis, as well as malaria. They work by modulating the immune system and reducing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200-400 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on body weight; consult a physician

name: Hydroxyurea Capsules
description: Hydroxyurea Capsules are used to treat chronic myeloid leukemia, head and neck cancer, and sickle cell anemia. They work by interfering with DNA synthesis to inhibit cancer cell growth or reduce sickling of red blood cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500-1000 mg daily or as directed by a doctor
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on body weight; consult a physician

name: Hydrocodone Bitartrate and Acetaminophen Tablets
description: Hydrocodone Bitartrate and Acetaminophen Tablets are combination pain relievers used for moderate to severe pain. Hydrocodone acts as an opioid analgesic, while acetaminophen enhances pain relief and reduces fever.
formula: Hydrocodone bitartrate 5 mg, Acetaminophen 325 mg per tablet

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours as needed for pain
recommendedDosage.children: Use under medical supervision

name: Hydrocortisone Sodium Succinate Injection
description: Hydrocortisone Sodium Succinate Injection is a corticosteroid used to manage severe inflammation, allergic reactions, and adrenal insufficiency. It is often used in emergency settings for conditions such as anaphylaxis or acute asthma exacerbations.
formula: Hydrocortisone sodium succinate 100 mg per vial

recommendedDosage.adults: 100-500 mg intravenously every 2-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight; consult a physician

name: Hydroxyprogesterone Caproate Injection
description: Hydroxyprogesterone Caproate Injection is a synthetic progestin used to prevent preterm labor in pregnant women at risk. It works by modulating hormonal activity to maintain pregnancy.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg injected intramuscularly once weekly during pregnancy
recommendedDosage.children: Not applicable

name: Hydroxyurea Tablets
description: Hydroxyurea Tablets are used to treat conditions such as sickle cell anemia, chronic myeloid leukemia, and certain cancers. They work by inhibiting DNA synthesis to slow the growth of abnormal cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500-1000 mg daily, adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage determined by body weight; consult a physician

name: Hydroxyzine Hydrochloride Syrup
description: Hydroxyzine Hydrochloride Syrup is an antihistamine used to treat allergies, anxiety, nausea, and skin conditions such as hives. It also has sedative properties that help in calming the nervous system.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-50 mg every 6-8 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a doctor for appropriate dosage

name: Hydrocortisone Acetate Suppositories
description: Hydrocortisone Acetate Suppositories are used to treat rectal inflammation caused by conditions such as hemorrhoids, ulcerative colitis, and proctitis. They reduce swelling, itching, and pain by suppressing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: Insert one suppository rectally twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a physician for dosage

name: Hydroxyethyl Starch Injection
description: Hydroxyethyl Starch Injection is used as a plasma volume expander in the management of hypovolemia caused by blood loss, surgery, or trauma. It works by increasing blood volume temporarily.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500-1000 mL intravenously as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage determined by body weight; consult a physician

name: Hydroxycarbamide Capsules
description: Hydroxycarbamide Capsules are used in the treatment of sickle cell anemia, chronic myeloid leukemia, and head and neck cancers. They work by reducing the formation of abnormal blood cells and slowing cancer cell growth.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500-1000 mg daily or as directed by a doctor
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a physician for appropriate dosage

name: Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose Ophthalmic Solution
description: Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose Ophthalmic Solution is an artificial tear solution used to relieve dry eyes. It provides lubrication to protect the eyes from irritation and dryness caused by environmental factors or reduced tear production.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 drops in each eye as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Safe for use; consult a doctor if symptoms persist

name: Hydroxypropyl Cellulose Ophthalmic Insert
description: Hydroxypropyl Cellulose Ophthalmic Inserts are used to manage dry eye conditions. These inserts dissolve slowly, providing prolonged lubrication to alleviate discomfort and irritation caused by chronic dry eye syndrome.
sideEffects: Foreign body sensation in the eye

recommendedDosage.adults: Insert one ophthalmic insert in each eye daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a physician for guidance

name: Hydroxyamphetamine Hydrobromide and Tropicamide Ophthalmic Solution
description: This combination ophthalmic solution is used to dilate the pupils (mydriasis) for diagnostic procedures or eye examinations. Hydroxyamphetamine stimulates the sympathetic nervous system, while tropicamide blocks parasympathetic signals to relax the eye muscles.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 drops in the eye 15-30 minutes before examination
recommendedDosage.children: Use under medical supervision

name: Hydroxyapatite Capsules
description: Hydroxyapatite Capsules provide a bioavailable form of calcium and phosphate for bone health. These are commonly used to support bone density, reduce the risk of osteoporosis, and promote recovery after fractures.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 capsules daily with meals
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for dosage

name: Hydroxyapatite Tablets
description: Hydroxyapatite Tablets are a convenient way to deliver calcium and phosphate to improve bone mineralization and overall skeletal health. They are suitable for individuals with calcium deficiencies or bone-related conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 tablets per day with meals
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a physician

name: Hydroxyapatite Oral Suspension
description: Hydroxyapatite Oral Suspension is a liquid form of calcium and phosphate used to support bone growth and repair, particularly in children and elderly patients who have difficulty swallowing pills.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mL twice daily with meals
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on age; consult a doctor

name: Hydroxyapatite Chewable Tablets
description: Hydroxyapatite Chewable Tablets are formulated for easy intake, providing a rich source of calcium and phosphate to strengthen bones and teeth. They are ideal for children and older adults.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2-4 tablets daily as needed
recommendedDosage.children: 1-2 tablets daily under supervision

name: Hydroxyapatite Effervescent Tablets
description: Hydroxyapatite Effervescent Tablets dissolve in water to provide an easy-to-drink supplement for bone health. They are especially useful for individuals who dislike swallowing pills.

recommendedDosage.adults: Dissolve 1 tablet in a glass of water daily
recommendedDosage.children: Half a tablet daily as advised

name: Hydroxyapatite Granules
description: Hydroxyapatite Granules are used in bone grafting procedures or as a dietary supplement to support skeletal health. They provide essential minerals for bone regeneration.

recommendedDosage.adults: One sachet daily for supplementation
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider

name: Hydroxyapatite Powder
description: Hydroxyapatite Powder is a versatile form used for dietary supplementation or in bone regeneration therapies. It can be mixed with liquids or food for easy consumption.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 teaspoon daily mixed with water or food
recommendedDosage.children: Half teaspoon daily under supervision

name: Hydroxyapatite Injectable Suspension

recommendedDosage.adults: Dose determined by surgical requirements
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended

name: Hydroxyapatite Dental Paste
description: Hydroxyapatite Dental Paste is used for remineralizing teeth, reducing sensitivity, and improving enamel health. It forms a protective layer over tooth surfaces.
formula: Hydroxyapatite nanoparticles in a dental paste

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a small amount on teeth twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Use under adult supervision

name: Hydroxyapatite Bone Graft Substitute
description: Hydroxyapatite Bone Graft Substitute is a biomaterial used in surgical procedures to aid in bone regeneration. It serves as a scaffold for new bone growth and helps in the healing of fractures or defects.

recommendedDosage.adults: Determined by surgical needs
recommendedDosage.children: Only for specific medical indications

name: Hydroxyapatite Coated Implants

recommendedDosage.adults: Determined by the type of implant and surgical procedure
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric procedures

name: Hydroxyapatite Scaffold

formula: Hydroxyapatite powder mixed with binders to form a porous scaffold
sideEffects: Delayed bone healing in some cases

recommendedDosage.adults: Customized based on the patient's needs and the size of the defect
recommendedDosage.children: Used in specific cases of bone defects

name: Hydroxyapatite Nanoparticles
description: Hydroxyapatite Nanoparticles are tiny particles of hydroxyapatite used for drug delivery, bone tissue regeneration, and as a biomaterial for medical applications.
formula: Hydroxyapatite nanoparticles suspended in a carrier medium

recommendedDosage.adults: Depends on the intended use, typically in controlled doses for specific therapies
recommendedDosage.children: Used in limited pediatric applications

name: Hydroxyapatite Microspheres
description: Hydroxyapatite Microspheres are small spherical particles of hydroxyapatite used in drug delivery, bone regeneration, and as a scaffold for tissue engineering.
formula: Hydroxyapatite microspheres formed through controlled precipitation

name: Ibuprofen Tablets

It is commonly used to treat conditions like arthritis, menstrual cramps, headaches, and muscle pain. Ibuprofen works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, which are chemicals responsible for pain and inflammation.
sideEffects: Increased risk of heart attack or stroke with long-term use

recommendedDosage.children: Dosage depends on age and weight, typically 5-10 mg/kg every 6-8 hours

name: Ibandronate Injection

recommendedDosage.adults: 420 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Imatinib Tablets

The inhaler delivers the medication directly to the lungs, providing rapid relief from symptoms such as wheezing, shortness of breath, and chest tightness.

It works by blocking the effects of a hormone that narrows blood vessels, which helps lower blood pressure and protect kidney function.

description: Kizvex is an antiviral medication used to treat conditions such as herpes simplex infections, including cold sores and genital herpes.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg five times a day for 5 days
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Kediat
description: Kediat is a medication used to treat gastrointestinal disorders, particularly acid reflux and ulcers. It neutralizes stomach acid and promotes healing of the stomach lining.

recommendedDosage.adults: Take 1-2 tablets after meals and before bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider before use in children

name: Kuddi
description: Kuddi is an herbal remedy traditionally used for its calming effects, particularly in managing anxiety and stress. It promotes relaxation and supports mental clarity.
formula: Herbal blend, typically with ingredients like Ashwagandha and Valerian root

recommendedDosage.adults: Take 1-2 capsules daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider before use in children

name: Kremzar
description: Kremzar is a topical medication used to treat fungal skin infections such as athlete's foot and ringworm. It prevents the growth of fungi by disrupting their cell membranes.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply topically to the affected area once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric use

name: Karmyl
description: Karmyl is used to treat hypertension by relaxing blood vessels and improving blood flow. It is often prescribed when lifestyle changes alone are insufficient to control blood pressure.
sideEffects: Swelling of the ankles or feet

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider before use in children

name: Kalmox
description: Kalmox is an antibiotic used for treating bacterial infections. It is commonly used for respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, and skin infections.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Kenoderm
description: Kenoderm is a topical medication used to treat inflammatory skin conditions such as eczema and psoriasis. It works by reducing inflammation and calming irritation.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to affected areas twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider before use in children

name: Lisinopril
description: Lisinopril is an angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor used primarily to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and to improve survival after a heart attack. It works by relaxing blood vessels and lowering blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-40 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Loratadine
description: Loratadine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms such as runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes. It works by blocking histamine receptors in the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Loperamide
description: Loperamide is an anti-diarrheal medication that works by slowing the movement of the muscles in the gut, reducing diarrhea. It is used to treat acute diarrhea and chronic diarrhea associated with conditions like irritable bowel syndrome.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2 mg after each loose stool, not to exceed 8 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Levothyroxine
description: Levothyroxine is a synthetic form of thyroid hormone used to treat hypothyroidism (underactive thyroid). It works by replacing or supplementing the thyroid hormone that the thyroid gland cannot produce.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 25-50 mcg once daily, adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lansoprazole
description: Lansoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) used to treat stomach ulcers, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome. It works by reducing the amount of acid in the stomach.

recommendedDosage.adults: 15-30 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lisinopril/Hydrochlorothiazide
description: This combination medication is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor, and hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that helps reduce fluid retention.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lyrica
description: Lyrica (pregabalin) is used to treat nerve pain, fibromyalgia, and seizures. It works by calming overactive nerve activity in the brain and spinal cord.

recommendedDosage.adults: 75-150 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Levofloxacin
description: Levofloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as pneumonia, urinary tract infections, and skin infections. It works by inhibiting bacterial DNA replication.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-750 mg once daily for 7-14 days
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lidocaine
description: Lidocaine is a local anesthetic used to numb tissues in a specific area of the body. It is commonly used for dental procedures, minor surgeries, and to treat arrhythmias.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply topically or inject as needed, doses vary by procedure
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lopressor
description: Lopressor (metoprolol) is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, heart failure, and angina. It works by slowing the heart rate and reducing the heart's workload.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-100 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lactulose
description: Lactulose is a synthetic sugar used to treat constipation and hepatic encephalopathy. It works by drawing water into the bowel and softening stools, making it easier to pass.

recommendedDosage.adults: 15-30 mL daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lofepramine
description: Lofepramine is a tricyclic antidepressant used to treat depression. It works by increasing levels of certain neurotransmitters, such as serotonin and norepinephrine, in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 70-140 mg once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lacosamide
description: Lacosamide is an anticonvulsant used to treat partial-onset seizures in people with epilepsy. It works by stabilizing overactive electrical activity in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100-200 mg daily, divided into 2 doses
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Labetalol
description: Labetalol is a beta-blocker and alpha-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and hypertensive emergencies. It works by relaxing blood vessels and slowing the heart rate.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100-400 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lamotrigine
description: Lamotrigine is an anticonvulsant used to treat epilepsy and bipolar disorder. It works by stabilizing electrical activity in the brain and modulating neurotransmitters.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-200 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lenvima
description: Lenvima (lenvatinib) is a targeted therapy used to treat certain types of cancer, including thyroid cancer, renal cell carcinoma, and hepatocellular carcinoma. It works by inhibiting cancer cell growth.

recommendedDosage.adults: 18 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lactobacillus
description: Lactobacillus is a genus of probiotics used to improve gut health. It helps balance the microbiota in the digestive tract and may aid in digestion and immune function.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-10 billion CFU per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lurasidone
description: Lurasidone is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. It works by affecting neurotransmitters such as serotonin, dopamine, and norepinephrine.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40-160 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lorazepam
description: Lorazepam is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety, insomnia, and seizure disorders. It works by enhancing the effect of a neurotransmitter called gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA).

recommendedDosage.adults: 2-6 mg daily, divided into 2-3 doses
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Levetiracetam
description: Levetiracetam is an anticonvulsant used to treat seizures in epilepsy. It works by stabilizing electrical activity in the brain and reducing seizure activity.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500-1500 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Liraglutide
description: Liraglutide is a glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonist used to treat type 2 diabetes and obesity. It works by enhancing insulin secretion, inhibiting glucagon release, and promoting satiety.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.6 mg daily for the first week, increasing to 1.2 mg daily, may be increased to 1.8 mg if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lurasidone Hydrochloride
description: Lurasidone Hydrochloride is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. It works by affecting neurotransmitters such as dopamine and serotonin.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40-160 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lidocaine Patches
description: Lidocaine Patches are used for localized pain relief, such as in conditions like postherpetic neuralgia. The patches release lidocaine, which numbs the affected area by blocking nerve signals.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply up to 3 patches to the affected area for 12 hours within a 24-hour period
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lindane
description: Lindane is an insecticidal medication used to treat scabies and lice. It works by killing the mites or lice by interfering with their nervous system.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply to affected areas and leave for 8-12 hours before washing off (scabies treatment)
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lignocaine
description: Lignocaine, also known as lidocaine, is a local anesthetic used to numb tissue in a specific area. It is commonly used in dentistry, surgery, and for minor skin procedures.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a topical solution or injection as prescribed by a healthcare provider
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lactated Ringer’s Solution
description: Lactated Ringer’s Solution is an intravenous fluid used for fluid and electrolyte replenishment. It is commonly used to treat dehydration, blood loss, and surgery recovery.
formula: Sodium chloride, potassium chloride, calcium chloride, sodium lactate in water
sideEffects: Local irritation at the injection site

recommendedDosage.adults: Infuse 500 mL to 2 L per day depending on clinical need
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: L-arginine
description: L-arginine is an amino acid supplement that helps improve blood flow by increasing nitric oxide production. It is often used for cardiovascular health, erectile dysfunction, and exercise performance.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2-3 grams per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: L-Methylfolate
description: L-Methylfolate is the active form of folate (vitamin B9) that helps in DNA synthesis and cellular repair. It is commonly used to treat folate deficiency and to support pregnancy.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400-800 mcg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Leflunomide
description: Leflunomide is an immunosuppressive drug used to treat rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis. It works by inhibiting the production of pyrimidines, which are required for cell division.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg daily for 3 days, followed by 20 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Laminaria
description: Laminaria is a type of seaweed that is used medically for its osmotic properties, often as a cervical dilator for labor induction or abortion procedures.

recommendedDosage.adults: Inserted by healthcare provider in a clinical setting
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric procedures

name: L-Glutamine
description: L-Glutamine is an amino acid supplement that plays a key role in protein synthesis, immune function, and gut health. It is often used to help with muscle recovery, gastrointestinal issues, and support for people with certain medical conditions like sickle cell anemia.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 grams daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lisdexamfetamine
description: Lisdexamfetamine is a central nervous system stimulant used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and binge eating disorder. It works by affecting certain chemicals in the brain that contribute to hyperactivity and impulse control.

recommendedDosage.adults: 30 mg once daily in the morning, may increase up to 70 mg
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Leuprolide
description: Leuprolide is a synthetic hormone used in the treatment of prostate cancer, endometriosis, and uterine fibroids. It works by reducing the amount of certain hormones in the body, leading to a decrease in the size of tumors or other abnormal growths.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 3.75 mg every month or 11.25 mg every 3 months
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lanreotide
description: Lanreotide is a synthetic peptide used to treat acromegaly, neuroendocrine tumors, and other conditions where hormone overproduction occurs. It works by inhibiting the release of certain growth hormones in the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg every 4 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lignocaine Injection
description: Lignocaine injection is a local anesthetic used to numb a specific area of the body during medical procedures. It works by blocking nerve signals in the area where it is injected.

recommendedDosage.adults: Varies depending on procedure, typically 1-3 mL of 1-2% solution
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: L-Carnitine
description: L-Carnitine is an amino acid derivative that plays a critical role in the transport of fatty acids into the mitochondria, where they are burned for energy. It is commonly used to support fat metabolism and improve exercise performance.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500-2,000 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Latanoprost
description: Latanoprost is a medication used to treat glaucoma and ocular hypertension. It works by increasing the outflow of fluid from the eye, reducing intraocular pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: One drop in the affected eye(s) once daily in the evening
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lurasidone Hydrochloride Tablets
description: Lurasidone Hydrochloride is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. It works by affecting neurotransmitters such as dopamine and serotonin to help manage symptoms of these conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40-160 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lincocin
description: Lincocin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections such as pneumonia and infections of the skin, bone, or soft tissue. It works by inhibiting bacterial protein synthesis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 600-1,200 mg daily, divided into 2 or 3 doses
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lofexidine
description: Lofexidine is used to manage withdrawal symptoms from opioids. It works by reducing the release of norepinephrine, which is thought to contribute to withdrawal symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2-4 mg per day, divided into doses
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: L-asparaginase
description: L-asparaginase is an enzyme used in the treatment of acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). It works by depleting the amino acid asparagine, which is essential for the survival of certain cancer cells, thereby inhibiting their growth.

recommendedDosage.adults: Varies based on the treatment protocol, typically 6,000 IU/m² intramuscularly or intravenously
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a pediatric oncologist for dosage

name: Laminin
description: Laminin is a protein found in the extracellular matrix, essential for cell adhesion, differentiation, and tissue repair. It is used in research and regenerative medicine to promote cell growth and tissue engineering applications.
sideEffects: None reported in medical use; primarily used in research

recommendedDosage.adults: Dosage depends on specific application in regenerative therapy or research
recommendedDosage.children: Not applicable for therapeutic use

name: Lacosamide Tablets
description: Lacosamide is an antiepileptic drug used to treat partial-onset seizures in adults and children. It stabilizes hyperexcitable neuronal membranes by enhancing the slow inactivation of sodium channels.

recommendedDosage.adults: Initial dose of 50 mg twice daily, titrated up to a maximum of 400 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies based on weight and age

name: Lactobacillus Acidophilus
description: Lactobacillus Acidophilus is a probiotic used to promote gut health and balance the intestinal microbiome. It is commonly used to prevent diarrhea, treat irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and support immune function.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-10 billion CFUs per day, depending on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Levocetirizine
description: Levocetirizine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms such as runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes. It works by blocking histamine receptors, reducing allergic reactions.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: 2.5 mg once daily for children aged 6-11 years

name: Lomustine
description: Lomustine is a chemotherapy medication used to treat brain tumors, Hodgkin's lymphoma, and other cancers. It belongs to the alkylating agent class and works by damaging the DNA of cancer cells, inhibiting their growth and replication.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 130 mg/m² as a single dose every 6 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage determined based on body surface area

name: Lazanda
description: Lazanda is a nasal spray containing fentanyl, used for managing breakthrough cancer pain in patients already tolerant to opioid therapy. It acts on the central nervous system to alleviate severe pain.

recommendedDosage.adults: One spray per nostril as prescribed, not to exceed four doses daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended

name: L-Cysteine
description: L-Cysteine is a sulfur-containing amino acid involved in protein synthesis, detoxification, and production of antioxidants like glutathione. It is used as a supplement for hair and skin health, as well as liver detox support.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-500 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Lenvatinib
description: Lenvatinib is a kinase inhibitor used to treat thyroid cancer, liver cancer, and renal cell carcinoma. It works by blocking multiple pathways involved in tumor growth and angiogenesis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 24 mg orally once daily, adjusted based on tolerability
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Metformin
description: Metformin is an oral antidiabetic medication primarily used to manage type 2 diabetes. It reduces glucose production in the liver and improves insulin sensitivity, helping lower blood sugar levels.

recommendedDosage.adults: Initial dose: 500 mg twice daily with meals; maximum dose: 2,000 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: 500 mg once daily, adjusted based on response

name: Methotrexate
description: Methotrexate is a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, psoriasis, and certain cancers. It inhibits folic acid metabolism, interfering with DNA synthesis in rapidly dividing cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 7.5-25 mg weekly for rheumatoid arthritis; cancer dosages vary by protocol
recommendedDosage.children: Varies depending on condition; consult a pediatric specialist

name: Metoprolol
description: Metoprolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, angina, and heart failure. It works by reducing the heart rate and the force of contraction, lowering blood pressure and oxygen demand.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50-100 mg twice daily for hypertension; adjusted based on condition
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for pediatric dosage

name: Montelukast
description: Montelukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist used to manage asthma and allergic rhinitis. It helps reduce airway inflammation and nasal congestion by blocking leukotrienes.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily in the evening
recommendedDosage.children: 5 mg once daily for ages 6-14 years; 4 mg for ages 2-5 years

name: Mupirocin
description: Mupirocin is a topical antibiotic used to treat bacterial skin infections, including impetigo and infected cuts or wounds. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by targeting isoleucyl-tRNA synthetase.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a small amount to the affected area 2-3 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults

name: Mirtazapine
description: Mirtazapine is an antidepressant used to treat major depressive disorder. It enhances the levels of norepinephrine and serotonin by antagonizing alpha-2 adrenergic receptors.

recommendedDosage.adults: 15-45 mg orally once daily, typically at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Meloxicam
description: Meloxicam is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammation associated with osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis. It inhibits COX enzymes, reducing prostaglandin production.

recommendedDosage.adults: 7.5-15 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: 0.125 mg/kg once daily (maximum 7.5 mg)

name: Morphine
description: Morphine is a potent opioid analgesic used to manage severe pain, including post-surgical and cancer pain. It acts on the central nervous system to alter pain perception and response.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-30 mg every 4 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies by weight and condition; consult a specialist

name: Methadone
description: Methadone is a long-acting opioid used for chronic pain management and opioid dependency treatment. It binds to opioid receptors in the brain to reduce withdrawal symptoms and cravings.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg every 8-12 hours for pain; maintenance dosage varies for dependency treatment
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended

name: Metronidazole
description: Metronidazole is an antibiotic and antiprotozoal agent used to treat infections caused by anaerobic bacteria and protozoa. It disrupts DNA synthesis in microorganisms, leading to cell death.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 8 hours for 7-10 days
recommendedDosage.children: 7.5 mg/kg every 8 hours for 7-10 days

name: Miconazole
description: Miconazole is an antifungal medication used to treat fungal infections of the skin, nails, and mucous membranes. It works by inhibiting the synthesis of ergosterol, an essential component of fungal cell membranes, leading to fungal cell death.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area twice daily for 2-4 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults, unless otherwise directed by a physician

name: Methylphenidate
description: Methylphenidate is a central nervous system stimulant used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy. It increases dopamine and norepinephrine activity in the brain, improving focus and reducing impulsivity.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-60 mg daily, divided into 2-3 doses
recommendedDosage.children: 5 mg twice daily, increased weekly as needed

name: Magnesium Oxide
description: Magnesium Oxide is a dietary supplement and antacid used to prevent and treat low magnesium levels and relieve heartburn or indigestion. It provides a source of magnesium, a mineral essential for various enzymatic reactions in the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-500 mg daily as a supplement; antacid dosage varies
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage depends on age and condition; consult a physician

name: Methimazole
description: Methimazole is an antithyroid medication used to treat hyperthyroidism, including Graves' disease. It works by inhibiting thyroid hormone synthesis by interfering with the iodination of tyrosine residues in the thyroid gland.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-30 mg daily, divided into 2-3 doses
recommendedDosage.children: 0.4 mg/kg daily, divided into 2-3 doses

name: Meclizine
description: Meclizine is an antihistamine used to prevent and treat nausea, vomiting, and dizziness associated with motion sickness and vertigo. It works by blocking histamine receptors in the brain that trigger these symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25-50 mg orally 1 hour before travel; may repeat every 24 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 12 years

name: Mefloquine
description: Mefloquine is an antimalarial medication used for the prevention and treatment of malaria. It acts by disrupting the replication and transcription of the Plasmodium parasite's genetic material.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg once weekly for prevention; 750 mg initial dose followed by 500 mg after 6-8 hours for treatment
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight; consult a healthcare provider

name: Misoprostol
description: Misoprostol is a synthetic prostaglandin E1 analog used to prevent stomach ulcers caused by NSAIDs, induce labor, and manage postpartum hemorrhage. It works by reducing stomach acid and increasing protective mucus secretion.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mcg 4 times daily for ulcer prevention; labor induction and postpartum doses vary
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Medroxyprogesterone
description: Medroxyprogesterone is a progestin hormone used in hormonal therapy for menstrual disorders, contraception, and hormone replacement therapy. It regulates ovulation and menstrual cycles.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-10 mg daily for 5-10 days for menstrual irregularities; contraceptive dosages vary
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for prepubertal use

name: Methylprednisolone
description: Methylprednisolone is a corticosteroid used to treat inflammatory and autoimmune conditions such as arthritis, asthma, and allergic reactions. It reduces inflammation by suppressing the immune response.

recommendedDosage.adults: 4-48 mg daily, depending on condition
recommendedDosage.children: 0.5-1 mg/kg daily; maximum dose varies by condition

name: Meropenem
description: Meropenem is a broad-spectrum carbapenem antibiotic used to treat severe bacterial infections, including those resistant to other antibiotics. It inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis, leading to bacterial death.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg-1 g intravenously every 8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: 20-40 mg/kg intravenously every 8 hours; maximum dose: 2 g/day

name: Mesalamine
description: Mesalamine is an anti-inflammatory medication used to treat inflammatory bowel diseases such as ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease. It works by reducing inflammation in the colon through inhibition of prostaglandin production.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2.4-4.8 g daily, divided into doses
recommendedDosage.children: Varies based on weight and condition; consult a physician

name: Methyldopa
description: Methyldopa is an antihypertensive medication used primarily to treat high blood pressure, especially during pregnancy. It works as a central alpha-2 adrenergic agonist, reducing sympathetic nerve signals to lower blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-500 mg 2-3 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: 10 mg/kg/day in divided doses; maximum 65 mg/kg/day

name: Methocarbamol
description: Methocarbamol is a muscle relaxant used to relieve muscle spasms and pain. It works by depressing the central nervous system without directly affecting skeletal muscle function.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1.5 g 4 times daily for the first 48-72 hours; reduce as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended

name: Metaxalone
description: Metaxalone is a muscle relaxant used to relieve discomfort from acute musculoskeletal conditions. It works through central nervous system depression to reduce muscle spasms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 800 mg 3-4 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 12 years

name: Milrinone
description: Milrinone is a phosphodiesterase-3 inhibitor used to manage acute heart failure and improve cardiac output in critically ill patients. It works by increasing intracellular calcium and enhancing myocardial contractility.

recommendedDosage.adults: Loading dose of 50 mcg/kg intravenously over 10 minutes; maintenance dose of 0.375-0.75 mcg/kg/min
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight and condition; consult a physician

name: Minocycline
description: Minocycline is a broad-spectrum tetracycline antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, acne, and certain types of arthritis. It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the 30S ribosomal subunit.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg every 12 hours
recommendedDosage.children: 4 mg/kg initially, then 2 mg/kg every 12 hours

name: Mometasone
description: Mometasone is a corticosteroid used to treat skin conditions, nasal allergies, and asthma. It reduces inflammation, itching, and swelling by suppressing the immune response.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply to the affected area once daily; inhaled or nasal dosages vary
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults, unless otherwise directed by a physician

name: Methylergonovine
description: Methylergonovine is an ergot alkaloid used to manage postpartum hemorrhage. It works by stimulating uterine contractions and reducing uterine bleeding.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.2 mg intramuscularly or orally every 2-4 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Mifepristone
description: Mifepristone is a progesterone receptor antagonist used for medical termination of pregnancy and controlling hyperglycemia in Cushing's syndrome. It blocks progesterone's action, leading to pregnancy termination or reduced cortisol effects.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg orally as a single dose for pregnancy termination; other dosages vary
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Metyrapone
description: Metyrapone is an adrenal enzyme inhibitor used in the diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency and treatment of Cushing's syndrome. It reduces cortisol production by inhibiting the enzyme 11-beta-hydroxylase.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-750 mg orally 2-4 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies by age and weight; consult a healthcare provider

name: Mecasermin
description: Mecasermin is a recombinant human insulin-like growth factor-1 (rhIGF-1) used to treat growth failure in children with severe primary IGF-1 deficiency. It promotes linear growth by stimulating cellular growth and development.

recommendedDosage.adults: Not typically used in adults
recommendedDosage.children: 0.04-0.12 mg/kg subcutaneously twice daily

name: Melatonin
description: Melatonin is a natural hormone supplement used to regulate sleep-wake cycles. It is commonly used to treat insomnia, jet lag, and other sleep disorders by mimicking the body's natural production of melatonin.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-10 mg orally at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: 1-5 mg orally at bedtime (under medical supervision)

name: Memantine
description: Memantine is an NMDA receptor antagonist used to treat moderate to severe Alzheimer's disease. It helps improve memory, attention, and daily functioning by regulating glutamate activity in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-20 mg daily, divided into doses
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Methazolamide
description: Methazolamide is a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor used to reduce intraocular pressure in glaucoma. It works by decreasing the production of aqueous humor in the eye.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50-100 mg orally 2-3 times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Midazolam
description: Midazolam is a short-acting benzodiazepine used as a sedative, anxiolytic, and anesthetic adjunct. It enhances GABA activity in the brain, inducing relaxation and sleep.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 mg intravenously; adjust based on response
recommendedDosage.children: 0.05-0.1 mg/kg intravenously; maximum 6 mg

name: Moxifloxacin
description: Moxifloxacin is a broad-spectrum fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat respiratory, skin, and intra-abdominal infections. It inhibits bacterial DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV, preventing bacterial replication.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mg orally or intravenously once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Magnesium Citrate
description: Magnesium Citrate is a saline laxative used to relieve constipation or to cleanse the bowel before medical procedures. It works by drawing water into the intestines to induce bowel movements.

recommendedDosage.adults: 240 mL orally as a single dose
recommendedDosage.children: 4-12 years: 100-150 mL orally as a single dose

name: Mivacurium
description: Mivacurium is a short-acting non-depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agent used during anesthesia to induce muscle relaxation. It acts by blocking acetylcholine at the neuromuscular junction.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.15-0.2 mg/kg intravenously
recommendedDosage.children: 0.2 mg/kg intravenously

name: Myozyme
description: Myozyme (alglucosidase alfa) is an enzyme replacement therapy used to treat Pompe disease, a rare genetic disorder caused by deficiency of acid alpha-glucosidase. It helps break down glycogen buildup in cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg/kg intravenously every two weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults; adjust based on weight

name: Macitentan
description: Macitentan is an endothelin receptor antagonist used to manage pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH). It reduces blood vessel constriction and improves exercise capacity.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg orally once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Methyclothiazide
description: Methyclothiazide is a thiazide diuretic used to treat hypertension and edema associated with congestive heart failure, liver cirrhosis, and kidney disorders. It works by reducing sodium reabsorption in the kidneys, leading to increased urine production.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2.5-5 mg orally once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Megestrol Acetate
description: Megestrol Acetate is a synthetic progestin used to treat loss of appetite and significant weight loss in cancer and AIDS patients. It is also used in the management of endometrial cancer and breast cancer.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400-800 mg orally daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Minoxidil
description: Minoxidil is a vasodilator used topically to treat hair loss and orally to manage severe hypertension. It stimulates hair follicles and relaxes blood vessels, improving blood flow.

recommendedDosage.adults: Topical: 1 mL twice daily; Oral: 2.5-5 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage for hypertension varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Mesna
description: Mesna is a protective agent used to reduce the risk of hemorrhagic cystitis caused by chemotherapy drugs like cyclophosphamide and ifosfamide. It neutralizes toxic metabolites in the bladder.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20% of the chemotherapy dose intravenously or orally
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults; adjust based on body surface area

name: Mecasermin Rinfabate
description: Mecasermin Rinfabate is a combination of recombinant human insulin-like growth factor-1 (rhIGF-1) and its binding protein IGFBP-3. It is used for treating severe primary IGF-1 deficiency in children.

recommendedDosage.adults: Not used in adults
recommendedDosage.children: 0.5-1 mg/kg subcutaneously daily

name: Maraviroc
description: Maraviroc is an antiretroviral drug used in combination therapy to treat HIV-1 infection. It blocks the CCR5 receptor, preventing the virus from entering host cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg orally twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Methscopolamine
description: Methscopolamine is an anticholinergic drug used to treat peptic ulcers and reduce stomach acid production. It also helps alleviate symptoms of gastrointestinal disorders like irritable bowel syndrome.

recommendedDosage.adults: 2.5-5 mg orally 30 minutes before meals
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Metoclopramide
description: Metoclopramide is a dopamine receptor antagonist used to treat nausea, vomiting, and delayed gastric emptying. It increases gut motility by enhancing acetylcholine activity.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-15 mg orally 30 minutes before meals and at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: 0.1-0.15 mg/kg per dose up to 4 times daily

name: Metipranolol
description: Metipranolol is a beta-blocker used to lower intraocular pressure in glaucoma and ocular hypertension. It works by reducing aqueous humor production in the eye.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 drop in the affected eye(s) twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Migalastat
description: Migalastat is a pharmacological chaperone used to treat Fabry disease, a rare genetic disorder. It stabilizes defective alpha-galactosidase A enzymes, improving their function in breaking down fatty substances.

recommendedDosage.adults: 123 mg orally every other day
recommendedDosage.children: Not approved for pediatric use

name: Methoxyflurane
description: Methoxyflurane is an inhalation anesthetic used for short-term pain relief in trauma and minor surgical procedures. It acts on the central nervous system to provide rapid analgesia.

recommendedDosage.adults: Up to 6 mL per day via inhaler
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults; adjust based on clinical need

name: Naproxen
description: Naproxen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce pain, inflammation, and fever. It is commonly prescribed for conditions like arthritis, muscle pain, and menstrual cramps.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-500 mg orally twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: 10 mg/kg daily in divided doses

name: Naltrexone
description: Naltrexone is an opioid antagonist used to treat alcohol dependence and prevent relapse in opioid addiction. It blocks the euphoric effects of alcohol and opioids.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg orally once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Naloxone
description: Naloxone is an opioid antagonist used to reverse opioid overdose. It rapidly binds to opioid receptors, displacing opioids and restoring normal respiration.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.4-2 mg intravenously, intramuscularly, or subcutaneously as needed
recommendedDosage.children: 0.01 mg/kg as needed; consult a healthcare provider

name: Neomycin
description: Neomycin is an aminoglycoside antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections of the skin, eyes, and ears. It is also used to reduce the risk of infection before surgery.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250-500 mg orally every 6 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Nifedipine
description: Nifedipine is a calcium channel blocker used to treat hypertension and angina. It relaxes blood vessels, improving blood flow and reducing blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 30-90 mg orally once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Nitroglycerin
description: Nitroglycerin is a nitrate used to prevent and treat angina pectoris (chest pain). It works by relaxing blood vessels and increasing blood flow to the heart.

recommendedDosage.adults: Sublingual: 0.3-0.6 mg as needed; up to 3 doses in 15 minutes
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Nizatidine
description: Nizatidine is an H2 receptor antagonist used to treat and prevent ulcers in the stomach and intestines. It also helps manage gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

recommendedDosage.adults: 150 mg orally twice daily or 300 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Nebivolol
description: Nebivolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure. It improves heart function by relaxing blood vessels and reducing heart rate.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg orally once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Nicotine
description: Nicotine is a stimulant and dependency-forming substance found in tobacco. It is used in nicotine replacement therapy to help people quit smoking by reducing withdrawal symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: Varies based on form: patches, gum, lozenges, or inhalers
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Nimodipine
description: Nimodipine is a calcium channel blocker used to improve neurological outcomes after subarachnoid hemorrhage. It increases cerebral blood flow by relaxing blood vessels in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg orally every 4 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric patients

name: Nivolumab

recommendedDosage.adults: 240 mg intravenously every 2 weeks or 480 mg every 4 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Nitrofurantoin
description: Nitrofurantoin is an antibiotic used to treat and prevent urinary tract infections (UTIs). It works by damaging bacterial DNA, making it effective against a broad range of bacteria in the urinary tract.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50-100 mg orally every 6 hours for 5-7 days
recommendedDosage.children: 5-7 mg/kg/day in divided doses

name: Nortriptyline
description: Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant used to treat depression and chronic pain conditions. It works by increasing the levels of norepinephrine and serotonin in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg orally 3-4 times daily, gradually increased to a maximum of 150 mg/day
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Nadolol
description: Nadolol is a beta-blocker used to treat hypertension and angina. It decreases the workload on the heart by reducing heart rate and blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40-320 mg orally once daily
recommendedDosage.children: 0.5-1 mg/kg/day in divided doses

name: Nalbuphine
description: Nalbuphine is an opioid analgesic used to manage moderate to severe pain and as an adjunct to anesthesia. It has a mixed agonist-antagonist action, reducing the risk of respiratory depression compared to other opioids.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-20 mg intravenously or intramuscularly every 3-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Natalizumab

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg intravenously every 4 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Nebulized Saline

recommendedDosage.adults: 2.5-5 mL via nebulizer 1-4 times daily as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

recommendedDosage.adults: 1,500 mg/m² intravenously on days 1, 3, and 5 of a 21-day cycle
recommendedDosage.children: 650 mg/m² intravenously daily for 5 days

recommendedDosage.children: 20-30 mg/kg orally twice daily

name: Neostigmine

recommendedDosage.adults: 15-375 mg orally daily in divided doses or 0.5-2.5 mg intravenously as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

name: Naproxen Sodium

recommendedDosage.adults: 220-440 mg orally every 12 hours, as needed

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg to 2,000 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in children

name: Norethindrone

recommendedDosage.adults: 60-120 mg before each meal
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for pediatric use

name: Naphazoline

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 sprays in each nostril every 6 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 6 years of age

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 gram orally, 3 times per day for 7-10 days
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies based on weight; consult a healthcare provider

description: Nimorazole Injection is an injectable form of the antibiotic nimorazole used for the treatment of infections caused by anaerobic bacteria, particularly in hospital settings.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 gram intravenously every 8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies based on weight; consult a healthcare provider

name: Nabumetone

sideEffects: Increased risk of heart attack or stroke

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg to 1,000 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Nicardipine

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg orally every 8 hours, adjust as necessary
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies; consult a healthcare provider

recommendedDosage.adults: 150 mg orally once daily for the first month, then 100 mg daily

name: Nitisinone

recommendedDosage.children: 1 mg/kg/day, taken orally

recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight; consult a healthcare provider

name: Nitric Oxide

recommendedDosage.children: Varies depending on the specific clinical condition

recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies based on clinical condition

name: Nadroparin

name: Nelarabine Injection

recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric populations

name: Nexplanon

name: Nitrofurazone

recommendedDosage.children: Apply a thin layer to the affected area 1-3 times daily

name: Nilotinib

name: Naldemedine

name: Oxycodone

name: Olaparib

recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric populations

name: Oxybutynin
