sideEffects: Burning or stinging in the eyes

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 drop in the affected eye(s) 2-3 times daily or as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider

name: Oxcarbazepine
description: Oxcarbazepine is an anticonvulsant used to treat epilepsy and partial seizures. It stabilizes electrical activity in the brain and reduces the frequency and severity of seizures.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on age and weight

name: Oxcarbazepine Tablets
description: Oxcarbazepine tablets are used to treat epilepsy and prevent partial seizures in adults and children. It works by stabilizing electrical activity in the brain to reduce the occurrence of seizures.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage varies based on age and weight

name: Oxygen
description: Oxygen is a vital element used in various medical therapies to treat patients with low blood oxygen levels or respiratory distress. It is commonly administered through nasal cannulas, masks, or mechanical ventilators.
sideEffects: Dryness in the nose or throat

recommendedDosage.adults: Administered as needed based on oxygen saturation levels (typically 88-92%)
recommendedDosage.children: Same as adults, depending on medical condition

name: Oritavancin
description: Oritavancin is a lipoglycopeptide antibiotic used to treat acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections (ABSSSI) caused by Gram-positive bacteria. It works by inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1,200 mg as a single intravenous infusion
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 18

name: Oxycodone/Acetaminophen
description: Oxycodone/Acetaminophen is a combination medication used to treat moderate to severe pain. It combines an opioid analgesic (oxycodone) with an over-the-counter pain reliever (acetaminophen).

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet every 4-6 hours as needed for pain
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for children

name: Opana
description: Opana is a brand name for oxymorphone, an opioid analgesic used to manage moderate to severe pain. It works by altering the way the brain and nervous system respond to pain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg every 4-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for children

name: Ospemifene
description: Ospemifene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) used to treat moderate to severe dyspareunia (pain during intercourse) caused by menopause. It works by mimicking estrogen effects in the vaginal tissues.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg once daily with food
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for use in children

name: Omeprazole/Antibiotic
description: Omeprazole/Antibiotic combination is used to treat Helicobacter pylori infections that cause ulcers and gastritis. It combines omeprazole, a proton pump inhibitor, with an antibiotic to reduce stomach acid and fight infection.

recommendedDosage.adults: Omeprazole 20 mg with antibiotic as prescribed, typically 7-14 days
recommendedDosage.children: Consult healthcare provider for pediatric dosing

name: Opioid
description: Opioids are a class of drugs that include prescription pain relievers, synthetic opioids, and heroin. They are used for pain relief but carry a high risk of dependence and overdose.

recommendedDosage.adults: As prescribed by a healthcare provider, based on pain severity
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for children without strict medical supervision

name: Omeprazole/Antibiotic Combination
description: Omeprazole/Antibiotic combination is prescribed to treat stomach ulcers caused by Helicobacter pylori infections. It combines omeprazole, a proton pump inhibitor, with an antibiotic to eradicate the infection and heal ulcers.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg of omeprazole and antibiotic as prescribed, typically for 7-14 days
recommendedDosage.children: Pediatric dosing should be determined by a healthcare provider

name: Omalizumab Injection
description: Omalizumab is a monoclonal antibody used to treat moderate to severe asthma and chronic idiopathic urticaria. It works by inhibiting IgE, a key player in allergic reactions, reducing the frequency of asthma attacks and hives.

recommendedDosage.adults: 150 mg once every 2-4 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight and specific condition

name: Oxychloroquine
description: Oxychloroquine is a medication used to prevent and treat malaria and to manage autoimmune conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis and lupus. It works by interfering with the growth of the malaria parasite in the red blood cells and by reducing inflammation in autoimmune diseases.

recommendedDosage.adults: For malaria: 200 mg twice daily for 3 days; for rheumatoid arthritis: 400-600 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on body weight and condition, prescribed by a healthcare provider

name: Ornithine
description: Ornithine is an amino acid used primarily in the urea cycle to remove excess ammonia from the body. It is often used as a supplement to improve exercise performance and reduce fatigue, as well as in treating conditions like hyperammonemia.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg to 1,000 mg per day, typically taken before exercise
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage should be determined by a healthcare provider

name: Oral Glucose Tablets
description: Oral glucose tablets are used to rapidly raise blood sugar levels in individuals with low blood sugar (hypoglycemia). They are commonly used by people with diabetes and can be consumed directly in the case of an emergency.
sideEffects: Upset stomach if taken in excess

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 tablets for mild hypoglycemia, follow with a balanced meal if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on age and weight, as recommended by a healthcare provider

name: Olaparib Oral
description: Olaparib is an oral medication used in the treatment of certain cancers, particularly ovarian and breast cancer, in patients with BRCA mutations. It works as a PARP inhibitor, preventing cancer cells from repairing damaged DNA and leading to cell death.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for use in children

name: Oxytocin Injection
description: Oxytocin injection is used in the management of labor, to stimulate uterine contractions, and to control postpartum bleeding. It is also used in certain situations to induce labor or aid in milk letdown in breastfeeding mothers.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 10-40 units in 1 liter of IV fluids, administered at a controlled rate during labor
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically administered to children

name: Oxycodone Hydrochloride
description: Oxycodone hydrochloride is an opioid pain medication used to manage moderate to severe pain. It works by altering the way the brain and nervous system respond to pain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-15 mg every 4-6 hours as needed for pain
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 12

name: Oxybutynin Chloride
description: Oxybutynin chloride is an anticholinergic medication used to treat overactive bladder symptoms, including frequent urination, urgency, and incontinence. It works by relaxing the bladder muscles.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg two to three times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on age and condition, typically 5 mg daily

name: Oseltamivir
description: Oseltamivir is an antiviral medication used to treat and prevent influenza (flu). It works by inhibiting the flu virus's ability to spread in the body, reducing the duration and severity of symptoms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 75 mg twice daily for 5 days
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight, typically 30-75 mg twice daily

name: Olmesartan Medoxomil
description: Olmesartan medoxomil is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). It works by relaxing blood vessels, making it easier for the heart to pump blood.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20-40 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 6 years of age

name: Oral Iron Supplements
description: Oral iron supplements are used to treat iron deficiency anemia by increasing iron levels in the body. They are commonly prescribed when the body does not have enough iron to produce hemoglobin, which is crucial for oxygen transport in red blood cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: Iron sulfate 325 mg once or twice daily, depending on condition
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on age and condition, prescribed by a healthcare provider

name: Oxycodone Extended Release
description: Oxycodone extended release is a powerful opioid used to manage severe, chronic pain. It releases the drug gradually over time, providing longer-lasting relief compared to immediate-release formulations.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-20 mg every 12 hours, depending on pain severity
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 18 years of age

name: Oflomelid
description: Oflomelid is a medication used to treat a variety of bacterial infections. It belongs to the class of antibiotics and is effective against several gram-positive and gram-negative organisms.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg twice a day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on body weight and condition

name: Oxyphenylbutazone
description: Oxyphenylbutazone is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammation associated with conditions such as arthritis. It works by reducing the production of prostaglandins, which are responsible for inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg twice daily, adjusted as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 12

name: Olaparib Tablets
description: Olaparib tablets are used in the treatment of cancers with specific genetic mutations, such as BRCA-mutated ovarian or breast cancers. It works by inhibiting the repair of damaged DNA in cancer cells, leading to cell death.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Opiate Antagonists
description: Opiate antagonists are drugs that block the effects of opioids by binding to opioid receptors in the brain. They are used in the treatment of opioid overdoses and to manage opioid dependence.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 0.4 to 2 mg of naloxone administered by injection for overdose
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight, typically 0.1 mg/kg

name: Oxygen Therapy
description: Oxygen therapy is used to treat patients with low oxygen levels in their blood. It is commonly used for conditions such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), pneumonia, and during recovery from surgery.
sideEffects: Oxygen toxicity (when used at high concentrations for extended periods)

recommendedDosage.adults: Variable, typically 1-6 liters per minute through nasal cannula or mask, adjusted according to patient's needs
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on condition and age

name: Oxaliplatin
description: Oxaliplatin is a chemotherapy drug used to treat colorectal cancer and other cancers. It interferes with the DNA of cancer cells, preventing their replication and ultimately causing cell death.

recommendedDosage.adults: 85 mg/m2 administered intravenously every 2 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage adjusted based on condition and weight

name: Obeticholic Acid
description: Obeticholic acid is used to treat primary biliary cirrhosis and non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). It works by activating the farnesoid X receptor (FXR), which regulates bile acid levels and liver function.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg once daily, adjusted based on liver function tests
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Oprelvekin
description: Oprelvekin is a recombinant form of interleukin-11 used to treat thrombocytopenia (low platelet count) in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy. It stimulates platelet production in the bone marrow.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mcg/kg subcutaneously once daily for up to 21 days or until platelet count recovery
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in children

name: Paracetamol
description: Paracetamol, also known as acetaminophen, is a widely used medication for relieving mild to moderate pain and reducing fever. It works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins in the brain, which are responsible for pain and inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg to 1000 mg every 4-6 hours as needed, not exceeding 4000 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight, typically 10-15 mg/kg every 4-6 hours, not exceeding 5 doses per day

name: Prednisone
description: Prednisone is a synthetic corticosteroid used to treat a wide variety of inflammatory and autoimmune conditions, including arthritis, asthma, and certain cancers. It works by suppressing the immune system and reducing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 5-60 mg per day depending on the condition being treated
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight and medical condition

name: Pantoprazole
description: Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) used to treat conditions such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), stomach ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome by reducing the amount of stomach acid produced.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for children under 5 years old

name: Phenytoin
description: Phenytoin is an anticonvulsant used to manage and prevent seizures, particularly in epilepsy. It works by stabilizing electrical activity in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg to 300 mg per day, depending on response
recommendedDosage.children: Dose adjusted based on body weight

name: Propranolol
description: Propranolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, heart problems, and anxiety. It works by blocking the effects of adrenaline on the heart and blood vessels.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40 mg to 160 mg per day, divided into 2-4 doses
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on weight and medical condition

name: Penicillin
description: Penicillin is an antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections by interfering with the formation of bacterial cell walls. It is effective against certain strains of bacteria.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg to 500 mg every 6-8 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on body weight and infection type

name: Piperacillin
description: Piperacillin is an antibiotic used in combination with tazobactam to treat serious infections, including pneumonia and urinary tract infections. It works by inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 3.375 g every 6 hours for serious infections
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on body weight and infection severity

name: Prednisolone
description: Prednisolone is a corticosteroid used to treat inflammatory and allergic conditions, as well as autoimmune diseases, by suppressing the immune system and reducing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5-60 mg per day, depending on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing adjusted based on body weight and medical condition

name: Prazosin
description: Prazosin is an alpha-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and symptoms of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). It works by relaxing blood vessels and muscles in the prostate.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 mg to 5 mg two to three times per day
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pioglitazone
description: Pioglitazone is an oral medication used to manage type 2 diabetes. It works by improving the body's sensitivity to insulin and reducing blood sugar levels.

recommendedDosage.adults: 15 mg to 45 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Piroxicam
description: Piroxicam is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammation associated with conditions such as arthritis. It works by inhibiting enzymes involved in the production of prostaglandins, which are responsible for inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg to 20 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for children under 12 years

name: Pravastatin
description: Pravastatin is a statin medication used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease. It works by inhibiting HMG-CoA reductase, an enzyme involved in cholesterol production in the liver.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg to 80 mg once daily, typically in the evening
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and medical condition

name: Paroxetine
description: Paroxetine is an antidepressant in the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) class. It is used to treat various mental health conditions, including depression, anxiety, and panic disorders, by increasing the levels of serotonin in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg to 50 mg daily, depending on condition
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Palbociclib
description: Palbociclib is a targeted therapy used in the treatment of certain types of breast cancer, particularly HR-positive, HER2-negative breast cancer. It works by inhibiting cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6, which are involved in cell cycle progression.

recommendedDosage.adults: 125 mg once daily for 21 days, followed by 7 days off
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Perindopril
description: Perindopril is an angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. It works by relaxing blood vessels and reducing the workload on the heart.

recommendedDosage.adults: 4 mg to 8 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pemetrexed
description: Pemetrexed is a chemotherapy drug used to treat certain types of cancer, including non-small cell lung cancer and malignant pleural mesothelioma. It works by interfering with the formation of DNA and RNA, inhibiting the growth of cancer cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg/m² body surface area every 21 days
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pyridoxine
description: Pyridoxine, also known as vitamin B6, is used to prevent or treat vitamin B6 deficiency. It is important for protein metabolism and the synthesis of neurotransmitters.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1.3 mg to 2 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and condition

name: Probenecid
description: Probenecid is used to treat gout by increasing the excretion of uric acid in the urine. It works by blocking the reabsorption of uric acid in the kidneys, helping to prevent gout attacks.

recommendedDosage.adults: 250 mg twice daily, increased to 500 mg twice daily if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Prazosin Hydrochloride
description: Prazosin Hydrochloride is an alpha-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and symptoms of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). It works by relaxing blood vessels and muscles in the prostate.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 mg to 5 mg two to three times per day
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pyrantel Pamoate
description: Pyrantel Pamoate is an anthelmintic drug used to treat intestinal worm infections, including pinworms, roundworms, and hookworms. It works by paralyzing the worms, allowing them to be eliminated from the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: Single dose of 11 mg/kg body weight
recommendedDosage.children: Dosage based on weight

name: Plerixafor
description: Plerixafor is a medication used to mobilize hematopoietic stem cells for collection and subsequent transplantation. It works by binding to the CXCR4 receptor on stem cells, preventing their retention in the bone marrow and promoting their release into the bloodstream.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.24 mg/kg body weight once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pentosan Polysulfate
description: Pentosan Polysulfate is a drug used to treat interstitial cystitis (bladder pain syndrome). It is believed to work by restoring the damaged glycosaminoglycan layer of the bladder lining and reducing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 100 mg three times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Promethazine
description: Promethazine is an antihistamine used to treat allergy symptoms, nausea, and vomiting, and to induce sedation. It also has antiemetic properties, making it effective for motion sickness and postoperative nausea.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg to 50 mg before sleep for allergy symptoms
recommendedDosage.children: Dose varies by age and condition

name: Pindolol
description: Pindolol is a non-selective beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and heart-related conditions such as angina. It works by blocking beta-receptors, reducing heart rate and blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg to 10 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Prazepam
description: Prazepam is an anxiolytic medication used to treat anxiety disorders. It is a member of the benzodiazepine class and works by enhancing the activity of neurotransmitters in the brain, resulting in a calming effect.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Piracetam
description: Piracetam is a nootropic drug often used to enhance cognitive function in individuals with dementia or cognitive disorders. It is believed to improve memory and learning ability by increasing blood flow to the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1,200 mg to 4,800 mg per day, divided into doses
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Polymyxin B
description: Polymyxin B is an antibiotic used to treat serious infections caused by Gram-negative bacteria. It works by disrupting the bacterial cell membrane, leading to cell death.

recommendedDosage.adults: 15,000 to 25,000 units/kg/day, divided into doses
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on weight and condition

name: Pindolol Hydrochloride
description: Pindolol Hydrochloride is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and angina. It works by blocking the effects of adrenaline on the heart, reducing heart rate and blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg to 10 mg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Phenobarbital
description: Phenobarbital is a barbiturate used as a sedative, anticonvulsant, and hypnotic drug. It works by depressing the central nervous system to prevent seizures and induce sleep.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg to 200 mg daily, depending on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and condition

name: Phenylephrine
description: Phenylephrine is a decongestant used to relieve nasal congestion caused by colds, allergies, or sinus infections. It works by constricting blood vessels in the nasal passages to reduce swelling and congestion.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg every 4 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and condition

name: Prednisolone Acetate
description: Prednisolone acetate is a corticosteroid used to treat inflammatory conditions such as arthritis, allergic reactions, and autoimmune disorders. It works by suppressing the immune system and reducing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 to 2 drops in the affected eye(s) two to four times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the condition and physician's instructions

name: Prasugrel
description: Prasugrel is an antiplatelet medication used to prevent blood clots in patients with acute coronary syndrome. It works by inhibiting platelet aggregation, reducing the risk of stroke, heart attack, or blood clots.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily after a loading dose of 60 mg
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pemetrexed Disodium
description: Pemetrexed disodium is a chemotherapy drug used to treat non-small cell lung cancer and malignant pleural mesothelioma. It works by inhibiting folate metabolism, which is necessary for cell division and growth.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg/m2 IV infusion every 21 days
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Phenylpropanolamine
description: Phenylpropanolamine is a sympathomimetic drug used as a decongestant and appetite suppressant. It works by constricting blood vessels in the nasal passages, reducing swelling and congestion.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mg to 75 mg every 4 to 6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Piroxicam Capsules
description: Piroxicam is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammation associated with conditions like arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis. It works by inhibiting cyclooxygenase enzymes, reducing inflammation and pain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pyridostigmine
description: Pyridostigmine is a medication used to treat myasthenia gravis, a condition that causes muscle weakness. It works by inhibiting acetylcholinesterase, an enzyme that breaks down acetylcholine, improving neuromuscular transmission.

recommendedDosage.adults: 60 mg to 150 mg three times a day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child's condition

name: Paliperidone
description: Paliperidone is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder. It works by altering the effects of neurotransmitters in the brain, including dopamine and serotonin.

recommendedDosage.adults: 6 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Paroxetine Hydrochloride
description: Paroxetine hydrochloride is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression, anxiety disorders, and PTSD. It works by increasing the levels of serotonin in the brain, improving mood and emotional stability.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily in the morning
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pentoxifylline
description: Pentoxifylline is a medication used to improve blood flow in patients with peripheral vascular disease. It works by reducing blood viscosity and improving red blood cell flexibility, which increases circulation.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mg three times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Prochlorperazine
description: Prochlorperazine is an antipsychotic and antiemetic used to treat nausea, vomiting, and psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia. It works by blocking dopamine receptors in the brain, reducing symptoms of nausea and psychosis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 5 mg to 10 mg two to three times daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child's condition

name: Perampanel
description: Perampanel is an antiepileptic drug used to treat seizures in people with epilepsy. It works by blocking excitatory neurotransmitters in the brain, helping to prevent seizures.

recommendedDosage.adults: 4 mg once daily, may be adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child’s weight and condition

name: Pentamidine
description: Pentamidine is an antimicrobial medication used to treat and prevent infections like Pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP) and leishmaniasis. It works by inhibiting the growth of certain types of parasitic and fungal infections.

recommendedDosage.adults: 300 mg IV once daily for 21 days for PCP treatment
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child’s weight and condition

name: Prandin
description: Prandin (repaglinide) is an oral medication used to manage type 2 diabetes. It works by stimulating the pancreas to release insulin, helping to control blood sugar levels after meals.

recommendedDosage.adults: 0.5 mg to 2 mg taken before meals
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pediatric Electrolyte Solution
description: Pediatric Electrolyte Solution is an oral rehydration solution used to treat dehydration in children due to diarrhea or vomiting. It contains a balance of electrolytes and fluids to replenish lost nutrients and prevent dehydration.
formula: Contains sodium, potassium, chloride, and glucose

recommendedDosage.adults: Not typically used in adults
recommendedDosage.children: Based on the child's condition, often 50 to 100 mL/kg of body weight

name: Proton Pump Inhibitors
description: Proton Pump Inhibitors (PPIs) are a class of medications used to reduce stomach acid production. They are commonly used to treat conditions like gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
sideEffects: Risk of bone fractures with long-term use

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 20 mg to 40 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child’s condition

name: Propranolol Hydrochloride
description: Propranolol hydrochloride is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, arrhythmias, and anxiety. It works by blocking the action of certain chemicals on the heart and blood vessels.

recommendedDosage.adults: 40 mg twice daily, may be adjusted based on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on weight and condition

name: Procarbazine
description: Procarbazine is a chemotherapy drug used to treat Hodgkin's lymphoma and other cancers. It works by inhibiting the growth of cancer cells by interfering with DNA synthesis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 50 mg/m2 daily for 14 days in a 28-day cycle
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on body surface area and condition

name: Pantoprazole Sodium
description: Pantoprazole sodium is a proton pump inhibitor used to treat conditions like GERD, ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome. It works by reducing stomach acid production.
sideEffects: Risk of bone fractures with long-term use

recommendedDosage.adults: 40 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on child’s condition

name: Prazosin Hydrochloride Capsules
description: Prazosin hydrochloride is an alpha-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and symptoms of PTSD, including nightmares. It works by relaxing blood vessels and improving blood flow.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 mg two to three times a day, may be adjusted as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Pimecrolimus
description: Pimecrolimus is a topical immunosuppressive drug used to treat atopic dermatitis (eczema). It works by inhibiting T-cell activation, reducing inflammation and immune responses in the skin.
sideEffects: Burning sensation at the application site

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to affected areas twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child's age and condition

name: Panadol 500mg Tablets
description: Panadol 500mg Tablets are an over-the-counter pain reliever and fever reducer commonly used for mild to moderate pain relief, such as headaches, muscle aches, and pain associated with colds. Panadol contains acetaminophen, which works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, chemicals in the brain that cause pain and fever. It is widely used due to its effectiveness and safety when used as directed. However, overdose can lead to severe liver damage, so it is important to follow dosage guidelines carefully.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 4-6 hours as needed, up to 4 grams per day

name: Quetiapine
description: Quetiapine is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat conditions such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder. It works by altering the effects of neurotransmitters in the brain, specifically serotonin and dopamine.
sideEffects: Increased cholesterol and blood sugar levels

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 25 mg once daily, increasing gradually to 300-400 mg daily depending on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on the child's age and condition

name: Quinapril
description: Quinapril is an ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. It works by relaxing blood vessels, which lowers blood pressure and reduces the workload on the heart.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose of 10 mg once daily, adjusted as needed up to 80 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Quinine
description: Quinine is an anti-malarial drug used to treat and prevent malaria, particularly for cases resistant to other medications. It works by interfering with the growth of parasites in the red blood cells.

recommendedDosage.adults: 400 mg three times daily for 7 days
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on weight and condition

name: Quinidine
description: Quinidine is an antiarrhythmic medication used to treat irregular heartbeats (arrhythmias). It works by slowing down the electrical impulses in the heart, helping to restore normal rhythm.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg three times a day, adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and weight

name: Quasense
description: Quasense is a birth control pill that contains a combination of estrogen (ethinyl estradiol) and progestin (levonorgestrel). It prevents pregnancy by inhibiting ovulation, thickening cervical mucus, and altering the uterine lining.

recommendedDosage.adults: One tablet daily, preferably at the same time each day
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for use in children

name: Quillivant XR
description: Quillivant XR is an extended-release form of methylphenidate used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). It works by affecting certain chemicals in the brain that contribute to hyperactivity and impulse control.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 20 mg once daily in the morning, may be adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Typically 20 mg once daily, adjusted based on age and response

name: Qvar
description: Qvar is an inhaled corticosteroid used to prevent asthma attacks. It works by reducing inflammation and swelling in the airways, helping to make breathing easier.

recommendedDosage.adults: 80 to 160 mcg twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and severity of asthma

name: Quinfamox
description: Quinfamox is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections. It works by preventing bacteria from forming their protective cell walls, ultimately killing the bacteria.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg every 12 hours, may be adjusted based on severity
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and weight

name: Questran
description: Questran is a bile acid sequestrant used to lower cholesterol and treat certain types of diarrhea. It works by binding bile acids in the intestines, preventing them from being reabsorbed into the bloodstream.

recommendedDosage.adults: 4 grams once or twice daily, may be increased as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: QuoVadis
description: QuoVadis is an implantable device used for birth control. It is a form of long-acting reversible contraception that releases a small amount of hormones over time to prevent pregnancy.

recommendedDosage.adults: Implant inserted once every 3 years by a healthcare provider
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for use in children

name: Quinagolide
description: Quinagolide is a medication used to treat conditions such as hyperprolactinemia, a condition characterized by high levels of prolactin. It works by inhibiting the release of prolactin from the pituitary gland.

recommendedDosage.adults: Start with 25 mcg once daily, increasing gradually up to 75 mcg daily based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Quinicrine
description: Quinicrine is an anti-malarial medication used for the treatment and prevention of malaria. It also has applications in treating autoimmune diseases such as lupus and rheumatoid arthritis.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg once or twice daily, based on the condition
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on weight and age

name: Quinagolide Hydrochloride
description: Quinagolide Hydrochloride is the hydrochloride salt form of quinagolide, used to treat conditions such as hyperprolactinemia. It acts by reducing prolactin secretion from the pituitary gland.

recommendedDosage.adults: 25 mcg once daily, increasing up to 75 mcg per day as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Qigong
description: Qigong is a traditional Chinese practice that combines movement, meditation, and controlled breathing to promote physical and mental well-being. It is often used to enhance health and prevent illness.
sideEffects: In rare cases, excessive practice may cause muscle soreness or fatigue

recommendedDosage.adults: Practice 15-60 minutes per session, 3-5 times per week
recommendedDosage.children: Can be adapted for children with guidance

name: Q-Tussin
description: Q-Tussin is a brand name for a combination medication that treats cough and cold symptoms. It typically contains an expectorant, decongestant, and sometimes a cough suppressant.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10-20 mL every 4-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing adjusted based on age and weight

name: Questran Light
description: Questran Light is a lower-calorie form of cholestyramine, a bile acid sequestrant used to lower cholesterol and manage cholesterol-related conditions. It works by binding bile acids in the digestive system and preventing their reabsorption.

recommendedDosage.adults: 4 grams once or twice daily, adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and weight

name: Quinidex
description: Quinidex is a brand name for quinidine, an antiarrhythmic drug used to treat irregular heartbeats (arrhythmias). It helps restore normal heart rhythm by slowing electrical conduction in the heart.

recommendedDosage.adults: 200 mg every 6 hours, adjusted based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on age and weight

name: Qsymia
description: Qsymia is a weight loss medication that combines phentermine (an appetite suppressant) and topiramate (an anticonvulsant). It is prescribed for overweight individuals with health conditions like hypertension or type 2 diabetes.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose of 3.75 mg/23 mg once daily, gradually increasing to 15 mg/92 mg once daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Qlux
description: Qlux is a brand name for a medication that can be used to relieve muscle pain and stiffness. It may contain a muscle relaxant or pain reliever.

recommendedDosage.adults: Take as directed, typically 1-2 tablets every 4-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children

name: Quinapril Hydrochloride
description: Quinapril Hydrochloride is an ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. It works by relaxing blood vessels, reducing the workload on the heart, and lowering blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose of 10 mg once daily, may be increased up to 80 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Quellor
description: Quellor is a medication used to treat conditions such as cold sores caused by the herpes simplex virus. It is an antiviral agent that helps to reduce the duration and severity of outbreaks.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 doses daily, depending on the severity of the outbreak
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Qualaquin
description: Qualaquin is an antimalarial medication used to treat and prevent malaria. It contains quinine sulfate, which works by interfering with the parasite's ability to reproduce in the blood.

recommendedDosage.adults: 648 mg three times daily for 7 days
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quercetin
description: Quercetin is a flavonoid found in many fruits and vegetables. It has antioxidant properties and is often used as a dietary supplement to reduce inflammation, boost immune function, and alleviate symptoms of allergies.

recommendedDosage.adults: 500 mg to 1,000 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Qti-Serum
description: Qti-Serum is a diagnostic product used in laboratories to measure the levels of specific proteins in the blood, assisting in the detection of certain medical conditions.
sideEffects: No known side effects as it is used for diagnostic purposes

recommendedDosage.adults: Used as directed in clinical settings
recommendedDosage.children: Used as directed in clinical settings

name: Qfever Vaccine
description: Qfever vaccine is used to prevent Q fever, a disease caused by the bacterium Coxiella burnetii. It is typically recommended for individuals at high risk, such as those working in farming or animal handling.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 dose, administered as an intramuscular injection
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically recommended for children

name: Quinoderm
description: Quinoderm is a topical treatment used for acne. It combines ingredients like benzoyl peroxide and potassium nitrate to reduce the severity of acne outbreaks and prevent new ones.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply a thin layer to the affected area once or twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quinsair
description: Quinsair is an inhaled antibiotic used to treat lung infections in patients with cystic fibrosis. It contains levofloxacin, which works by stopping the growth of bacteria in the lungs.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 vial (240 mg) inhaled twice daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Qadruple Antiretroviral Therapy
description: Qadruple Antiretroviral Therapy is a combination therapy used to treat HIV. It typically includes four different medications that work together to inhibit the replication of the virus in the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: Dosing depends on the specific combination of antiretroviral drugs
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Qotec
description: Qotec is an antimicrobial solution used to treat a variety of infections caused by bacteria or fungi. It is often prescribed for topical or systemic use depending on the type of infection.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply as directed by a healthcare provider
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quadramet
description: Quadramet is a radiopharmaceutical used for pain relief in patients with bone cancer. It contains samarium-153, a radioactive substance that is absorbed by bone tissue to help alleviate pain from bone metastases.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 dose (up to 1 mCi/kg) administered intravenously
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Quinora
description: Quinora is an over-the-counter product used for treating and preventing symptoms related to respiratory infections, such as cough and congestion. It typically contains a combination of active ingredients like antihistamines and decongestants.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1 tablet every 4-6 hours as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quinolone Antibiotics
description: Quinolone antibiotics are a class of broad-spectrum antibiotics used to treat various bacterial infections, including urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, and gastrointestinal infections. Common examples include ciprofloxacin and levofloxacin.

recommendedDosage.adults: Dosage varies depending on the infection, typically 250-750 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children except in specific cases

name: Quillichew ER
description: Quillichew ER is an extended-release tablet of methylphenidate, used to treat attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). It helps to improve focus, impulse control, and hyperactivity in individuals with ADHD.

recommendedDosage.adults: 20 mg once daily, increased based on response
recommendedDosage.children: 5-10 mg once daily, adjusted as needed

name: Quinipril
description: Quinipril is an ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and heart failure. It works by relaxing blood vessels, which allows blood to flow more easily and lowers blood pressure.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily, adjusted based on blood pressure response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quick-Mix
description: Quick-Mix is a powder preparation used for making oral rehydration solutions. It helps to replace fluids and electrolytes lost due to dehydration from conditions like diarrhea or vomiting.

recommendedDosage.adults: Mix as directed and drink as needed for hydration
recommendedDosage.children: Follow the instructions on the package

name: Q-Zyme
description: Q-Zyme is a digestive enzyme supplement that helps break down food and improve digestion. It is commonly used by individuals who have difficulty digesting certain foods due to enzyme deficiencies.

recommendedDosage.adults: Take 1-2 tablets with meals as directed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quetherapy
description: Quetherapy is a treatment approach combining medications, lifestyle changes, and therapy, particularly in the management of complex diseases like rheumatoid arthritis. It may include a range of pharmaceutical agents tailored to the patient’s needs.

recommendedDosage.adults: Follow prescribed therapy plan specific to the disease being treated
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically used in pediatric care

name: Qulipta
description: Qulipta is a medication used for the prevention of episodic migraines. It works by inhibiting certain receptors in the brain to reduce the frequency and severity of migraine attacks.

recommendedDosage.adults: 10 mg once daily, may increase depending on response
recommendedDosage.children: Not approved for use in children

name: QVC-HT
description: QVC-HT is a branded formulation used for the management of high blood pressure. It typically combines a diuretic and a vasodilator to lower blood pressure effectively.

recommendedDosage.adults: Once daily, or as prescribed by a healthcare provider
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for pediatric use

name: Quinnite
description: Quinnite is a nutritional supplement designed to support the health of bones and joints. It often contains glucosamine and chondroitin, which are believed to aid in cartilage repair and reduce joint pain.

recommendedDosage.adults: 1-2 capsules daily with food
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Qscalp
description: Qscalp is a topical solution used to treat dandruff and other scalp conditions. It typically contains active ingredients like ketoconazole, which helps in reducing fungal infections and dandruff flakes.

recommendedDosage.adults: Apply to the scalp twice a week or as directed by a healthcare provider
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate use

name: Quink
description: Quink is an ink used primarily for writing and printing purposes. It is known for its distinctive blue-black color and is commonly used in fountain pens.

recommendedDosage.adults: Use as needed for writing, ensure to store properly to avoid spills
recommendedDosage.children: Supervised use recommended

name: Quinolone Injection
description: Quinolone injection is a class of antibiotics used to treat serious bacterial infections, typically given intravenously for severe conditions like pneumonia, urinary tract infections, or sepsis.

recommendedDosage.adults: Varies depending on the infection, typically 400-800 mg every 12 hours
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for proper dosing

name: Quickie
description: Quickie is a brand of personal care products designed for convenience, such as quick-dry wipes, hand sanitizers, and other hygiene-related products. These items are typically used for quick cleaning in situations where soap and water are not available.

recommendedDosage.adults: Use as needed for cleaning hands or surfaces
recommendedDosage.children: Use under adult supervision

name: Quetiapine Fumarate
description: Quetiapine fumarate is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat disorders like schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depressive disorder. It works by balancing neurotransmitters in the brain to reduce symptoms like hallucinations and mood swings.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose typically 25 mg twice daily, increased as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not typically prescribed for children under 13 years

name: Quinogyl
description: Quinogyl is a medication used in the treatment of malaria and certain protozoan infections. It works by inhibiting the growth of the parasite responsible for the infection.

recommendedDosage.adults: Follow prescribed dosage, usually 200 mg every 12 hours for 5 days
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage based on weight

name: Quinoxalines
description: Quinoxalines are a class of organic compounds that have antibacterial properties. They are used in the development of treatments for bacterial infections, particularly in situations where other antibiotics may be ineffective.

recommendedDosage.adults: Dosage depends on the specific formulation and infection being treated
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for specific dosing

name: Qtonic
description: Qtonic is a brand of herbal supplement often used to support energy levels, immunity, and general well-being. It is typically made from natural ingredients like ginseng, ginger, and other herbs known for their health benefits.

recommendedDosage.adults: Take 1-2 capsules daily with food
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children

name: Quinlor
description: Quinlor is a medication used in the treatment of bacterial infections, specifically respiratory and urinary tract infections. It belongs to the class of quinolone antibiotics, which inhibit bacterial growth by interfering with DNA replication.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 500 mg twice daily for 7 days, or as prescribed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children unless specifically prescribed

name: Ranitidine
description: Ranitidine is a medication used to reduce stomach acid production. It is commonly used to treat conditions such as acid reflux, peptic ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 150 mg twice daily or 300 mg at bedtime
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage based on age and weight

name: Rosuvastatin
description: Rosuvastatin is a statin medication used to lower cholesterol levels in the blood. It helps reduce the risk of heart disease, stroke, and other cardiovascular conditions.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose is typically 10 mg once daily, can be increased up to 40 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for children under 10 years of age

name: Risperidone
description: Risperidone is an atypical antipsychotic used to treat mental health disorders such as schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and irritability associated with autism.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 1-2 mg per day, adjusted as needed up to 8 mg per day
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing varies based on age and condition; consult a healthcare provider

name: Ropinirole
description: Ropinirole is a medication used to treat Parkinson's disease and restless legs syndrome. It works by stimulating dopamine receptors in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose is usually 0.25 mg three times daily, can be increased as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate use

name: Rivaroxaban
description: Rivaroxaban is an anticoagulant (blood thinner) used to prevent and treat blood clots in conditions such as deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, and atrial fibrillation.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 10 mg once daily for prevention, 20 mg once daily for treatment
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Rifampin
description: Rifampin is an antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections, most commonly tuberculosis. It works by inhibiting bacterial RNA synthesis.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 10 mg/kg of body weight daily
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing depends on weight, consult a healthcare provider

name: Risedronate

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 35 mg once a week or 5 mg daily
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate use

name: Requip
description: Requip is a brand name for ropinirole, used to treat Parkinson's disease and restless legs syndrome by stimulating dopamine receptors in the brain.

recommendedDosage.adults: Starting dose is usually 0.25 mg three times daily, can be increased as needed
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate use

name: Rocuronium
description: Rocuronium is a muscle relaxant used during surgery or mechanical ventilation. It works by blocking the transmission of nerve impulses to muscles.

recommendedDosage.adults: Dosage is determined by the anesthesiologist based on the procedure
recommendedDosage.children: Use in children is also determined by the healthcare provider

name: Ranolazine
description: Ranolazine is used to treat chronic angina (chest pain). It works by improving blood flow to the heart, reducing the frequency of angina episodes.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 500 mg twice daily, can be increased to 1000 mg twice daily if needed
recommendedDosage.children: Not recommended for use in children

name: Reglan
description: Reglan (metoclopramide) is a medication used to treat nausea, vomiting, and gastric motility disorders. It works by increasing the movement of the stomach and intestines.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 10-15 mg up to 4 times a day before meals
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing depends on weight; consult a healthcare provider

name: Reyataz
description: Reyataz (atazanavir) is an antiretroviral medication used to treat HIV. It works by inhibiting the HIV protease enzyme, preventing the virus from multiplying in the body.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 300 mg once daily with food
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage based on age and weight

name: Remicade
description: Remicade (infliximab) is a monoclonal antibody used to treat autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis, Crohn's disease, and ulcerative colitis. It works by blocking the action of tumor necrosis factor (TNF).

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 3 mg/kg intravenously at weeks 0, 2, and 6, followed by every 8 weeks
recommendedDosage.children: Dosing based on weight and disease; consult a healthcare provider

name: Rheumatrex
description: Rheumatrex (methotrexate) is a chemotherapy drug also used for autoimmune diseases, including rheumatoid arthritis. It works by suppressing the immune system and reducing inflammation.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 7.5 mg once a week, can be increased based on response
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Rivastigmine

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 1.5 mg twice daily, can be increased gradually up to 6 mg twice daily

name: Rapamune

name: Rocaltrol

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 0.25 mcg daily, can be adjusted based on calcium levels
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Rifapentine

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 10 mg/kg once weekly, in combination with other TB medications
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Requip XL

name: Riluzole

name: Rizatriptan

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 150 mg twice daily or 300 mg once daily

name: Renvela

name: Revolade

name: Rheumatrex (Methotrexate)

name: Rocaltrol Capsules
description: Rocaltrol (calcitriol) is a synthetic form of vitamin D used to treat calcium deficiencies and certain disorders like rickets or osteomalacia.

recommendedDosage.adults: Typically 0.25 mcg to 1 mcg daily, adjusted based on calcium levels
recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Rizatriptan Benzoate

name: Remicade Injection

recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Rytary

name: Rifaximin

name: Rivaroxaban Oral

name: Rocaltrol Injection
description: Rocaltrol (calcitriol) injection is a synthetic form of vitamin D used to treat calcium deficiency associated with hypoparathyroidism and renal osteodystrophy. It increases calcium absorption in the intestines.

name: Tizanidine Hydrochloride

name: Tegretol
description: Tegretol (carbamazepine) is an anticonvulsant medication used to treat epilepsy, neuropathic pain, and mood disorders like bipolar disorder. It works by stabilizing the electrical activity in the brain.

recommendedDosage.children: Consult a healthcare provider for appropriate dosage

name: Temozolomide
description: Temozolomide is a chemotherapy drug used to treat certain types of brain cancer, including glioblastoma. It works by inhibiting DNA repair mechanisms, leading to the death of cancer cells.

name: Tegaserod
